title: Light Meditation
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until October 2nd.

Let the qualities of sunshine fill your cup in this class! Release stress, improve your mood and allow revitalizing energy in.

title: Pre-Race Primer
body:
This yoga practice is tailored for runners who are in active training for a race or are looking for ways to maintain mobility and prevent injury. Yoga is a fantastic compliment to running and keeps joints and connective tissues happy and healthy. It also increases lung capacity and recovery.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • IT Band Release

title: Melt Your Stress
body:
Leave your day behind as you cleanse your mind and your body with gentle twists and sweet heart openers. We lean into the shoulders and hips with ease to melt the layers of stress that are sometimes hidden from ourselves.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Anahatasana (Heart Melt)
  • Lunge Twist
  • Gomakasana (Shoe Lace)

title: Well-Wishing Meditation
body: In this short meditation, we will send some good energy to someone in your life by holding them in your mind’s eye and wishing them well.

title: Upper Body and Core Focus
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until September 14th.

This intermediate class with Kathi is a full-body pilates practice with a focus on the upper body.

You can view Kathi's Lower Body and Core Focus class here.

title: Postnatal Yoga for Prolapse
body:
Support yourself and aid in your recovery from prolapse in this gentle beginner class with Julia.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Supported Bridge
  • Pelvic Floor Engagement

title: Practice for Energy
body:
This short and sweet practice with Josh is designed to give you a boost of energy. Note: You will need two blocks. This video is part of an up-and-coming series of short practices, each designed to invoke a specific mood. 

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Kapalabhati
  • Down Dog Plank Flow
  • High Lunge with Temple Mudra

title: How to Support Your Weight in Side Plank
body:
David takes you through stages that help you understand how to best stabilize the shoulders and use the deep core to support and strengthen the body while doing side plank pose (vasisthasana). 

To learn more about shoulder and core anatomy, check out the following courses from our 250-Hour Online Yoga Teacher Training Program: Introduction to the Bandhas, Anatomy of the Core and Anatomy of the Shoulder.

title: Shake Off Stagnation
body: Julia gets you moving in fun and creative ways throughout this vinyasa class. Let your whole body shake, dance, and flow as we move stagnant energy, lymph, and fascia to leave you feeling energized and clear again.

title: Free Yourself
body:
This hatha practice with Helen combines moving the spine with journal questions that ask you what you need in order to feel free in your body and life. 

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Half Butterfly
  • Warrior I
  • Revolved Pyramid

title: Energizing Embodied Prenatal Flow
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until August 21st.

Tap into intuition and foundation in this full spectrum empowering prenatal flow practice with Tara. We'll move with intention and be given plenty of options/variations to make room for our babies and ever-changing bodies. This practice ends with healing bamboo chimes, as well as light and water visualizations linked with breath.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Goddess Squat with Eagle Arms
  • Warrior III Walks

title: Practice for Grounding
body:
This beginner practice with Josh is designed to settle you into a more grounded energy. This video is part of an up-and-coming series of short practices, each designed to invoke a specific mood.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Lizard
  • Malasana
  • Pigeon
  • Supine Crook Lying Breathing
  • Chair Up Down

title: How to Do Ardha Chandrasana
body:
Join Rachel for this quick and informative tutorial to master half moon, ardha chandrasana.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Ardha Chandrasana

title: 10-Minute Pilates Express
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until August 10th.

If you don't have a lot of time but still want to get your pilates fix, this 10-minute practice with Kathi is perfect for you. Please take a few minutes to warm up. Note: A block is optional for this class.

title: Movement as Medicine
body:
A whole body sequence built on repetition that gets you moving in all the right places to keep the body energized, vital and mobile.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Tree
  • Eagle
  • Cowface

title: Active Hips and Hands
body:
This is a fun dynamic practice that targets active hip openers and hand-balances. A focus on the foundations of the hips and the hands will help you build up some more complex poses.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Flying Pigeon
  • Eka Pada Galavasana

title: Lower Body and Core Focus
body:
Join Kathi in this intermediate pilates class that focuses on legs, glutes and of course, a fair dose of core.

You can view Kathi's Upper Body and Core Focus class here.

title: Pelvic Floor Health and Postnatal Care
body: This beginner class is designed to bring strength, awareness, and healthy tone back to the pelvic floor and deep abdominals. With new mamas in mind, it's also perfect for anyone looking to find a deeper connection with the deep core and stabilizers. Though this practice is fairly gentle, the subtle connections that you are invited to foster here, and will serve you well with more dynamic classes, as well as in daily life.

title: Back to the Core
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until July 20th.

Join Tracey in this deep core activation practice, and balance between the front and back body.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Little Bridge

title: Find Peace In Your Body
body:
This beginner class combines the practice of self-touch and gentle movement with journaling questions that invite you to find a deeper sense of peace in your body.

Part of an up-and-coming Journaling Series.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Sphynx

title: No Stress: Shoulders & Chest Prenatal Flow
body:
Find relief and a sense of freedom from side body to shoulders, to the neck, and to mind in this mostly low-to-ground dynamic practice. This class also invites you to use your voice vibration as a relaxation tool and soothing comfort measure.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Strap Shoulder Work
  • Gate Pose with Strength Components

title: Nidra: Creativity Activation
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until July 10th.

Somewhere between sleep and wakefulness is the practice of Nidra. In this guided meditation, allow yourself to be transported to another dimension to ignite creativity and manifest your desires.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Savasana

title: Practice for Focus
body:
Join Josh in this 20-minute vinyasa practice that is designed to sharpen your focus. This video is part of an up-and-coming series of short practices, each designed to invoke a specific mood. 

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Utthita Padangustasana
  • Eagle
  • Plank

title: Prenatal Pilates Series: Day 5
body:
This class is the final day of the Prenatal Pilates Series with Julia. You’ll integrate the different exercises you’ve been working on throughout the series to fully support your changing body now, and set you up for success during the postnatal period.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Side Bend & Twist
  • Hip Lift & Marching

title: Prenatal Pilates Series: Day 4
body:
Enjoy Day 4 of our Prenatal Pilates Series with Julia! Continue to build your strength, coordination, and balance to support you in your pregnancy and beyond. There’s pelvic floor work as always!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Single Leg Balance
  • Band Work
  • Hip Lift

title: Prenatal Pilates Series: Day 3
body:
Welcome to Day 3 of our Prenatal Pilates Series with Julia! As your strength builds you’ll be adding on to your practice with some fun new exercises.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Wall Push-Up
  • Side Lying Series

title: A Practice For Your Belly
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 26th.

This class sends a little love to your belly, an area that we often avoid or only focus on in the hopes of shrinking or flattening. Through this gentle twisting practice with lots of invitations for belly connection, you are invited to acknowledge and make space for this incredible part of you.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Reclined Twists / Contact with Belly

title: Portable Practice
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 22nd.

This is a short and very portable class you can do anytime and anywhere! We often find ourselves wishing we could have a little yoga break in our day, especially when we don’t have time to go to a studio or even have a mat. You will be on your feet the entire time during this practice. No mat is required - just the desire to move your body and energy!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Revolved Crescent Lunge

title: Creating Your Nest
body: This practice with Julia is all about slowing down and connecting with your baby. You'll nurture any uncomfortable spaces in your body all the while celebrating the creative forces at play within you.

title: Yoga for Ankles, Feet and Toes
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peek of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 15th.

This 30-minute practice with Melissa will help you reconnect with your feet and develop more awareness around your ankles, feet, and toes.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Kneeling Gate

title: Prenatal Pilates Series: Day 2
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 12th.

Enjoy Day 2 of our Prenatal Pilates Series with Julia and prepare yourself for labor and delivery, and recovery after. You’ll focus on the pelvic floor and improving your posture.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Swimming Prep
  • Side Kick
  • Clams

title: Prenatal Pilates Series: Day 1
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 12th.

Enjoy the first day of the Prenatal Pilates Series with Julia! This series will focus on supporting you throughout your pregnancy, setting you up for delivery, and preparing you for a faster return to normal after birth. Day 1 is a simple run-through of areas you’ll strengthen throughout the series. Pelvic floor anyone?

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Clams
  • Hip Lifts
  • Swimming Prep

title: Form, Function & Flow
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until June 8th.

Come explore "little riffs and shifts" on postures you may already know while getting to PLAY with them with a somewhat functional movement approach. The aim to work within the trifecta: stability, agility and mobility. This practice with Tara is full spectrum (whole body), dynamic, and somewhat "athletic" and empowering.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Tree
  • Core Work
  • Lunge Variations
  • W3 Variations

title: Yoga For Body Workers
body:
Are you a bodyworker or someone who does a lot of work with your hands? This class is for you! It’s time for some self-care for our caretakers. In this yummy flow, we’ll target the areas that frequently get tight or neglected, like the forearms and hands, as well as do some delicious chest and hip flexor openings to help balance out work where we are frequently hunched over.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Backbends

title: Strengthen and Lengthen
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until May 29th.

Join Araba in this strong and active hatha sequence to strengthen and lengthen your quad muscles.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Lizard

title: Deep Devotion
body:
When we do anything with a devotional quality, the impact and energy are amplified greatly. Step into this dynamic flow with intention, devotion and presence in every movement and moment.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Warrior Variations
  • Awkward Pyramid

title: Slow and Low
body:
We are offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until May 22nd.

This mellow class with Melissa will help you get into your body and out of your head.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Reclined Twist
  • Seated Twists

title: Your Winter Sun
body: Sometimes a long winter or stagnant period can leave us feeling lethargic and sticky. This class is designed to gently help you start to waken your inner sunshine and stay motivated after a period of rest. Let that burning light within you, however, it shows up, start glowing and shining again!

title: Comfort Food
body:
In this practice with Josh, we will do some very well-loved yoga poses that may not be the most challenging, but bring a sense of ease and belonging to the body. This practice is like a bowl of warm stew on a rainy day.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Cat Cow Child Pose
  • Cobra Pose
  • Low Lunge
  • Figure 4 Stretch

title: Find Your Purpose
body:
Helen takes yoga off and on the mat in this practice. This class combines movement with journaling questions that invite you to find your purpose while moving into deep hip opening poses, as well as fun modified balancing poses.

Part of an up-and-coming Journaling Series.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Dragon Lunge/Modified Half Moon

title: Twist It Out
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until May 8th.

Join Araba in this strong and active hatha sequence, full of twists to engage the core and support good digestion.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Revolved Side Angle

title: 3-Dimensional Core
body:
Although we often think of the “core” as being the abdominals, the deep muscles that support our spine are actually 360. In this class with Rachel, we target all aspects of the core for engagement and strengthening: the front, sides, and back. This is an excellent class for strengthening and supporting lower back health.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Side Plank
  • Salabhasana (Locust)

title: Santosha: Cultivating Contentment
body: Often we're plagued by the thought, "If this happens, then I'll be happy." But what if it doesn't have to be so? What if life truly is enough all the time? In this class, Julia will explore the yogic concept of 'Santosha' or 'contentment' while guiding you through a hatha practice.

title: A Guided Meditation for Peace in Your Body
body: This meditation invites you to examine the beliefs you have about your body, aiming to highlight the positive while releasing or shrinking the negative. The mind is a powerful thing and practicing this meditation regularly may strengthen your ability to feel good in your body, exactly as it is.

title: Moon Dance
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until April 25th.

 

This playful flow with fun transitions works towards half-moon and revolved half-moon. The movements in the sequence invite us to explore balance and expansion, as well as breath and focus.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Half-Moon
  • Revolved Half Moon

title: Bound Half Moon
body:
In this challenging practice with Josh, we will work on setting up for a bound half moon. There will be lots of options offered, so hop on and give it a try!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Bound Half Moon

title: Rise & Revitalize
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until April 3rd.

An invigorating and playful practice for the intermediate-advanced student geared toward helping awaken, and find clarity and energy early in the day (or when you need a burst!) This practice will include twists, hip openers, back bends, and inversions.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Handstand
  • Camel to Wheel
  • Arm Balance Options

title: Focus on Feeling
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until March 27th.

Yoga helps us open the feeling centers of our body. This practice with Fiji guides us into a place of listening to the sensations and letting them guide us.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana

title: Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle: Menstrual
body:
Steering clear of any negative connotations associated with this time of the month, Julia guides you through gentle restorative stretches and movements to help support and honor your system. Take the time to listen to your innate knowing and intuition, creating a restful space in your cycle to recharge and prepare to create anew in the weeks to come.

This class is Phase 4 of Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Supported Twist

title: Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle: Luteal
body:
During the luteal phase of your hormonal cycle, your hormones steadily drop off until menstruation. Often we feel more in tune with what’s important in our lives and what we might need to wrap up or finish off in our lives. This class is specific for supporting your system during this time with a slower flow and thyroid stimulation.

This class is Phase 3 of Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Moon Salutation
  • Shoulder Stand

title: Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle: Ovulatory
body:
This class is for the days during the height of your hormonal cycle when you’re ovulating and some, but not all, are feeling energized. Enjoy getting your energy moving and challenging yourself with some fun flows and movements.

This class is Phase 2 of Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Wild Thing
  • Wheel

title: Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle: Follicular
body:
The follicular stage of your cycle is when your hormones start to rise again following menstruation. Julia curated this class to help you celebrate your body during this time, focusing on creativity, rising energy levels, and nurturing your system in a way that will help set you up for the weeks to come. 

This class is Phase 1 of Yoga for the Female Hormonal Cycle.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Half Moon
  • Triangle

title: Journey to Splits
body:
This practice with Araba is an active hatha sequence that prepares the body for splits by lengthening the hamstrings and building awareness and strength in standing balance poses.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Splits

title: Primal Exploration
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until March 20th.

Tap into your wild side with this practice with Josh. We will move in flowy and intuitive ways to explore every nook and cranny of the body.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Cat Cow Exploration
  • Warrior II
  • Open Arms Flow
  • Wild Thing
  • Crow/Single-Leg Crow

title: Practicing Tapas
body: The word Tapas is derived from the root Sanskrit verb ‘tap’ which means ‘to burn’, and evokes a sense of ‘fiery discipline’ or ‘passion’. In this class, Julia encourages you to cultivate your own sense of self-discipline and passion as you move forward with life and your personal goals.

title: Crow Workshop
body: In this workshop with Rachel, learn tips and tricks to prepare for and practice the crow pose.

title: Mindful Awareness
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until February 27th.

Araba helps you get grounded and increase your awareness in this short guided mindfulness meditation.

title: A Dance With Breath
body:
We are now offering a 2-week free preview of some of our new subscriber-only content! We hope you enjoy this sneak peak of the classes we are currently working on.

Note: This class will be free to access until February 24th.

This movement experience is a practice intended to feel fluid and graceful as you ride the waves of your breath. You'll have plenty of opportunity for repetition and dynamic movement at a clip that feels quite fluid. Explore unique yet intuitive transitions and an excellent balance of strength, flexibility, and balance. 

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • High Lunge
  • Wide-Legged Forward Flow
  • Inversion Option

title: Yoga for Creating Strength and Flexibility
body:
This foundational class explores vital poses in yoga that help create strength and flexibility over time. Fiji guides you through a sequence and explains how each pose works and how to set it up with stability in mind.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Warrior I and II

title: Yoga for Sleep and Anxiety
body:
Yoga is known for its positive impact on stress and anxiety. How do we create a regular routine that helps us with our own stress and anxiety? Join Araba in this gentle calming practice to introduce yoga and breathwork to ease anxiety and prepare for sleep.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Forward Folds

title: Expand the Edge
body:
In this very dynamic and playful practice, Fiji invites you to step out of your comfort zone and expand your edges. Each segment will work on incrementally advancing certain poses.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Revolved Half Moon
  • Handstand Prep
  • Headstand

title: Foundations of Practice Livestream Recording
body:
In this livestream with Rachel, you will be guided through a strong and clear advanced beginner's class. A perfect opportunity to reconnect to the basics. 

This livestream is Day 20 of The 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey. Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Revolved Half Moon

title: Beginner-Friendly Flow Livestream Recording
body:
This simple flow with Josh integrates basic yoga principles such as alignment, breathing, and core engagement. We will go through poses slowly and then put them together in a strong simple sequence.

This livestream is Day 15 of The 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey. Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Half Moon

title: Balance It Out!
body:
Balances galore! Join Araba in this strong, energy-inducing Hatha sequence that increases the concentration.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Focused Fire
body:
Fire is a powerful and transformative element. This practice gets us to harness that energy and use it in a focused and intentional way.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

Shiva Stance

title: Yoga Fundamentals Check-In Livestream Recording
body:
For students of all levels, David brings you back to yoga's fundamentals, reminding you how to engage the supportive core muscles (bandhas), balance effort and release and get the best from your yoga practice.

This livestream is Day 6 of The 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey. Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

Revolved Triangle

title: Core Fitness Flow
body:
Join Josh in this high-energy practice with a heavy focus on core strengthening. Feel the burn!

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Plank Arm Lift
  • Knee to Nose
  • Core Twist Rotations
  • Prone Back Extensions
  • Side Plank

title: Free Flow: Core Strong & Twists
body:
This class takes you on a methodical, functional, and fluid approach to accessing, building core strength, and awakening the spine with safe, detailed, and innovative spinal twists. A challenge for beginners and foundations reset for those more advanced, this practice is bound to make just about anyone feel more agile, more awake, and well-aligned.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: A Simple Guide to the Physical Practice of Yoga
body:
An absolute beginners class in which Julia guides you through some common yoga poses and sequences. She'll explain everything you need to know to start your very own yoga practice at home such as how to avoid hurting yourself, how to know when you're doing it 'right', and how to choose classes based on your needs.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

title: Root to Rebound
body:
In this practice we look at how we can use the foundations of our hands and feet to create a lightness to our practice, sourcing the ground for strength and support.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Half Moon

title: Hibernating Over The Holidays
body: Over partied, socialized, stressed, or worked at this time of the year? Come home to your mat and self in this slow, restorative class with Julia. Take time for yourself so that you're able to show up as you'd like to going forward.

title: Holiday Season Calm
body:
This class with Helen invites you to get into your hips, breathe deeply and ponder a few questions that might hold the key to a grounded and happy holiday season. Enjoy!

Part of an up-and-coming Journaling Series.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Pigeon/Bound Root Pose

title: Lift Your Heart
body:
This yin practice aims to lift your heart both figuratively and literally with deep backbends, long holds, and full breathing. If your goal in yoga is to stretch, yin yoga is the practice for you!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Sphynx/Seal Pose
  • Supported Fish

title: Rainbow Mindfulness Meditation
body: In this meditation focused on mindfulness, we will be looking to our surroundings to help ground the mind. Best done in a vibrant setting, for example, out in nature.

title: Guide to the Key Transition
body:
This is a tutorial on how to do the transition between plank, chaturanga, and upward dog safely and sustainably.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Plank
  • Chaturanga
  • Upward Dog

title: Pros of Using Props
body: This is an informational video to encourage the use of props for all students.

title: Post Game Yoga
body:
David uses his combined experience and skill set as a massage therapist and yoga teacher to guide you through a highly effective Yoga for Athletes class that is designed to help your body recover from hard training or a game. There is no down-time in this class - David takes advantage of every available moment to help you target and release the key muscles around your pelvis, including your hips, hamstrings, quads and lower back.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

title: The Work Break
body: Take a few minutes out of your day to release the stresses associated with desk/computer work. Breathe, stretch, and regain your focus.

title: Yin Yoga for Feet and Ankles
body:
This yin practice is all about stretching and opening one of the most common areas of tension in the body - your feet and ankles. If kneeling is not comfortable for your body, then simply join in and double up on the seated component of the class. Enjoy!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Seated Butterfly/Half Butterfly

title: Yoga for Anxiety: Playfulness
body:
Anxiety can reduce one's ability to let go and play! In this unconventional yoga class, we’ll be exploring the theme of play and having fun in our practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Strength & Support for Mental Wellness Program.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Lunges
  • Sun Salutations

title: Yoga for Anxiety: Building Strength and Resiliency
body:
Adding strength training to your routine can be an amazing way to build up physical and emotional strength. In this unconventional yoga class, we’ll be weaving strength work throughout our practice. Get ready to feel strong and capable! Note: You will need one pair of medium to heavy weights for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Strength & Support for Mental Wellness Program.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Sun Salutations

title: Yoga for Anxiety: Moving with Breath
body:
Moving with breath can be a wonderful way to drop into the body and get out of your head. In this gentle class with Melissa, you’ll be encouraged to match your pace of movement with your own breath cycles. 

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 of Strength & Support for Mental Wellness Program.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • ½ Sun Salutations
  • Cat/Cow Curls
  • Reclined Twists
  • Bridge

title: Yoga for Singers
body: This sweet class is designed specifically for singers and vocal performers. We’ll target the muscles and areas needed to increase lung capacity, increase throat relaxation, and support beautiful vocalizing. By incorporating humming into the practice, we’ll soothe the vocal cords and warm up the voice. Perfect for warming up, or cooling down, from vocal work.

title: Core Fusion Flow
body:
Join Fiji in this fusion flow as you work through core strengthening series along with powerful vinyasa flows. You will definitely feel this one tomorrow!

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Alternating Core Sets
  • Warrior III

title: Gentle Hips: A Deep Release
body:
Join Araba in this deep exploration of the hips. Through long held postures, this practice invites release of tension and emotions being stored in the hips.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Mermaid/One-Legged King Pigeon

title: Boundless & Bright: Guided Meditation
body: With Ganesha's melodically sung mantra (remover of obstacles), guided visualizations for breath and tools for quieting the chatter of the mind, Tara leads you to feel clear, vibrant and awake in your skin. This helps set positive affirmation, and to feel limitless, powerful and joyful. Note: You may want to have a bolster, cushion or blanket to sit on.

title: Humble Brag
body:
In this challenging intermediate class, we’ll explore all sorts of deep delicious hip openers, such as humble warrior, full splits, bird of paradise, and bound ardha chandrasana. This class is designed to knock us off our balance so that we can keep practicing a humble return to our own center.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Vasisthasana to Hanumanasana

title: A Gentle Release for the Shoulders and Back
body:
Do you often experience tightness in your shoulders and back? Join Araba in this short practice as she guides you through a relaxed hatha sequence to release tension in these areas.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Full Forward Fold

title: Free Flow: Fluidity & Flight
body:
Please help us welcome our newest instructor, Tara Heal!

Join Tara in this challenging full-spectrum vinyasa flow class that is both strong and graceful. Breath-guided movement, dynamic fluidity, play with innovative and fun transitions, work with balance and agility in terms of quick weight transfer and play with arm balances and inversions.

Key Pose(s) include: 

  • Handstand Variations
  • Arm Balance Options ie. Flying Pigeon

title: Open Your Heart to Joy in Your Body
body: Through self-touch, grounding and a heart-opening hatha practice, we explore our relationship to our body and consider how we can support ourselves in finding peace, ease and joy.

title: Pawanmuktasana Series 1: Anti-Rheumatoid Group
body:
Please help us welcome our newest instructor, Araba Adjaye!

A gentle series to increase mobility in all the joints, taken from the Anti-Rheumatoid group in traditional hatha. This can be practiced regularly as a stand-alone class, or before any other class.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minutes of Self-Care
body: This final day of our challenge is a juicy one! It will help you to slow down, stretch the tight places, and invite you back home to yourself. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 14 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Stress Buster
body: Today’s practice is designed to help you shake the cobwebs off your day and clean your energetic slate. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Heart Opening
body: Today’s practice is designed to help you open your front body, reclaim your posture, and open your heart. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 12 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Stress Relief
body: This energizing breath practice is an excellent way to release unwanted tension and clear out your system for a fresh start. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 11 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minutes Upside Down
body: Today’s practice plays with inversions prep to help you wake up your upper body and change your perspective. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 10 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Juicy Flow
body: Today’s practice is a juicy flow that is perfect for morning or evening to reconnect to your breath and find some fluidity. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 9 of Embrace The Micro Practice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minutes To Iron Out Your Kinks
body: Today’s practice brings us to the halfway point of our challenge, and is perfect for stretching, strengthening and expanding your whole body. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of Embrace The Micro Practice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minute Energy Burn
body: This fierce little practice will generate heat, fire up your energy and give you an immediate reset. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Embrace The Micro Practice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Energy Transformation
body: Today’s kapalabhati session helps to fire up your energy, engage your core and re-energize your body. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Embrace The Micro Practice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minutes To Prepare For Sleep
body: Today’s micropractice is designed to help you get ready for sleep. Incorporate this series into your end-of-day routine to aid in your sleep hygiene. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minute Desk Antidote
body: Today’s micropractice is a great reset for a mid-day work break, whether you’ve been desking, parenting or erranding. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Embrace The Micro Practice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Wake Up
body: Today’s micropractice is great to incorporate early on in your day to get your energy up and your body awake. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 10 Minute Calm Me Down
body: Today’s micropractice is designed to create calm and de-stress your body and mind. This is the perfect class to end a workday and transition out of stress mode. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Micropractice: 5 Minute Pick Me Up
body: This practice with Rachel is a quick energizer and perfect for a mid-day pick me up. It can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 of Embrace The Micropractice: 14-Day Beginner Challenge.

title: Yin Yoga for Deep Hip Opening
body: This yin class with Helen targets everybody’s favorite tight spot... The hips!

title: Yoga at the Airport
body: Travelling? Stuck in uncomfortable clothing? Tired of sitting? This class is for you! Work out the kinks of travel while at the airport, train station, or anywhere else.

title: Your Mid Flight Break
body: Yoga for on the airplane or any other tight space where you can’t move much at all! Get your blood gently flowing into your extremities to help prevent deep vein thrombosis, and stretch some of those areas that often tighten up during travel.

title: A Whole Body Challenging Beginner Hatha Flow
body: David guides you through a full-body, slow-flow hatha yoga class that first establishes your core stability, and then moves you through a series of standing poses that gradually increase in difficulty. This class will help you release your whole body, with a particular focus on the hips, hamstrings and lower back.

title: Activated Asana Series: Whole Body
body: This practice incorporates elements from all the classes in the series. It ties together the power of the upper and lower body through the core.

title: Activated Asana Series: Energy
body:
This class is Day 4 of the Activated Asana Series and focuses on elevating our energy. This dynamic practice moves energy systematically through the body with pranayama and fluid asana.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Activated Asana Series: Core
body: This class is Day 3 of the Activated Asana Series and focuses on creating and activating core strength to tie in the power of the upper and lower body. Having a strong and stable core will unlock potential in almost all your poses.

title: Activated Asana Series: Shoulders
body: This class is Day 2 of the Activated Asana Series and helps us to activate the shoulders and upper body to have stronger and more stable foundations in arm balances.

title: Activated Asana Series: Legs
body: This class is Day 1 of the Activated Asana Series and focuses on creating a strong foundation for balancing poses. It will give you the strength and tips needed to take your standing poses to the next level.

title: Ease into Sleep
body: Fiji lulls you gently towards a restful sleep in this short restorative practice. There are mindful movements to untangle tension in the neck and shoulders followed by gentle and supportive restorative postures using a bolster. In the end the stage is set for a peaceful slumber.

title: Quiet Your Inner Critic
body: In this intermediate hatha class with Helen, we explore the possibility that yoga can support us in quieting our inner critic, especially when we move through poses that require our full focus. Through twists, backbends and balances, you are invited to remind yourself of all that you are, while releasing that voice that tries to tell you otherwise.

title: Twist It Out
body: Join Tracey in this playful practice that works with twists and transitions of standing splits, ardha chandrasana, skandasana and binds.

title: Rising Strong: The Rise
body: In this final class in the Rising Strong series inspired by Brené Brown’s inspiring guidebook, we put the process - the reckoning, the rumble, the revolution - into practice. We empower ourselves to rise to whatever challenges we have yet to face. We build strength and mobility in our shoulders and upper backs to bravely let our hearts shine. Suitable for experienced beginners wanting to deepen their practice, or intermediate yogis wanting to refine their technique.

title: Rising Strong: The Revolution
body: Inspired by Brené Brown’s Rising Strong process, in this third class in the Vulnerability series, we begin our revolution on our own terms. We cultivate the strength to stand firmly on our own two feet, to make use of props to support us, and to engage our core to revolve from the inside out. Suitable for experienced beginners wanting to deepen their practice, or intermediate yogis wanting to refine their technique.

title: Rising Strong: The Rumble
body: We have been carrying the weight of the world on our shoulders. In this second class in the Vulnerability series, inspired by Brené Brown’s Rising Strong process, we begin to rumble with the places in our bodies where we habitually store our tension. We give ourselves permission to release through honesty, stillness, and awareness that is offered through this yin yoga practice. Suitable for all levels including brand new yogis.

title: Rising Strong: The Reckoning
body: Inspired by Brené Brown’s Rising Strong process, in this first class in the Vulnerability series, we begin to reckon with the transformations we have undergone these past years of the COVID pandemic. We move fluidly to elongate our side bodies, examine the areas where we stockpile our stories of tension, injury, and self-doubt, and begin to empower ourselves for the next chapter. Suitable for experienced beginners.

title: Yoga for TMJ Pain Relief
body: Is your jaw tense? Do you experience frequent headaches and pain in your neck and jaw? In this short class, David takes you through a series of exercises that help you release the tension in your face, jaw, head and neck, relieving the symptoms of TMJ and chronic neck pain. You will learn how to massage, trigger point, stretch and relax the key muscles that are causing you discomfort.

title: Full Body Pilates
body:
Pilates from head to toes! Enjoy this dynamic class with Julia to build core strength, increase mobility and improve your posture.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Renewed Space
body:
Moving through all seven chakras we lift ourselves up, inspire and illuminate. A full body flow as we honor the release of any and all contractions to expand into our full potential.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Inspired Joy
body:
Moving through our sixth chakra we connect with our intuition without the filter of past or future, expectations or judgment. Flow through warriors, lunges, and continued focus on our personal strength and commitment.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Steady Cruise
body:
Moving through your fifth chakra with inspiration and expression. Shoulder openers, long limber lines and inspiration to move through plough, and optional shoulder stand. Our throat chakra offers us freedom of the words that bind us - both out loud and silently to ourselves.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Lean In
body:
Focus on your fourth chakra, offering love and self-love. We have created the space for release and forgiveness. Now we will lean in to open our hearts and embrace the light.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Light Beckons
body:
Focus on your third chakra, offering the heat, the fire, and the strength of self. In this class we look at deep core emphasis, mind/body transitions, and playful sun salutations to align the body, mind, and heart.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Building Waves
body:
Focus on your second chakra, moving with breath, repetition, and fluidity. In this class, we begin the journey through the chakras sparking creativity, self-expression, strength, and grace.

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Reflect Within
body:
Focus on your root chakra, offering a home base, stability, and security. Allow your inner witness to take you toward trusting yourself. Building from the ground up with movement and breath!

This class is part of Tracey's Ebb and Flow of Expansion Series.

title: Mindful Eating
body:
Welcome to our first audio class! We'd love to hear your feedback.

Optimize your connection to your next meal by starting this audio class with Julia before you eat. Using mindfulness you’ll slow down, truly appreciate the form of nourishment you’re about to give your body, and enjoy a meditative moment while you eat.

title: Nourish Your Body: Restore and Heal
body: In today’s fast paced world, we often downplay the importance of rest and gentle movements to nourish our bodies and minds. Focussing on the importance of rest as physical, mental and energetic nourishment instead, Julia guides you through a truly restorative practice.

title: Loving Kindness Meditation
body: Julia creates this 10 minute space as an opportunity for you to tap into your inner self, connecting to breath. Julia uses mantra and visualization to help boost those love feelings of love and joy within yourself.

title: Nourish Your Body from the Get-Go: Morning Class
body: Start your day with Julia by setting an intention to nourish yourself all day long. You’ll focus on improving your digestion and setting yourself up so that your body can best assimilate all that you consume throughout the day. This morning class is meant to be done before you eat.

title: Nourish Your Mind: Meditations
body: In this class Julia guides you through moving and then reclining meditations to help remove blocks that may be impeding the proper nourishment of your body. You’ll move to break through some of what’s been holding you back, and then open to allow for healing and expansion.

title: Nourish Your Body: Strength Fusion
body: In this fusion class Julia guides you through yoga asana and pilates exercises focussed on nourishing your body by strengthening your muscles and finding balance where you may need it.

title: Connection: Energy
body: In the fifth class of this 5-class series, you will be connecting, feeling and moving the energy in your body. David’s clear guidance and choice of breathing techniques and mindfulness exercises will help you clear energetic blockages, feeling lighter, less tired and more energized.

title: Connection: Focus
body:
In the fourth class of this 5-class series, David helps you focus your attention in a clear, present and calm manner as you move through the yoga practice, helping you stay focused and minimize distraction in your life.

You can find the fifth class here.

title: Connection: Calm
body:
In the third class of this 5-class series, David teaches you how to establish and maintain calmness in your body and mind. His guidance keeps you focused and relaxed and the flow helps you release the many thoughts and worries in your head.

You can find the fourth class here.

title: Renewal of the Sacred Fire
body: In Sanskrit, Punaradhana means “renewal of the sacred fire”. How do we renew our own sacred fire within us? The fire of our practice, of our lives and what gets us on our mat? We heat it up! Join Jonni-Lyn for this flowing and thoughtful class to renew your own  sacred fire.

title: Revisit, Refresh and Renew
body: Revisit some familiar poses, looking at them from a different and fresh perspective. This strong but peaceful class will help you to explore and renew some favorites and introduce you to a few new experiences. Please note: Blocks are optional for this practice.

title: Connection: Earth
body:
In the second class of this 5-class series, you will be guided through a blend of asana, pranayama and meditation that helps you feel grounded, rooted and relaxed in your body. David’s focus is especially on the lower back, hips and legs and feeling the energetic connection to the earth.

You can find the third class here.

title: Planting the Seeds of Renewal
body:
In every moment we are planting seeds of what will grow. In this practice we will explore easy, fluid movement and notice our intentions along the way. Where does our mind go? What seeds are we taking care of in our body and our life?  The practice leads up to a full lotus with variations included.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Connection: Body
body:
For the first class in this 5-class series, David helps you loosen your body and connect to sensation using pranayama, meditation and asana. He helps you give attention to your whole body while encouraging you to practice mindfully.

You can find the second class here.

title: Reigniting the Feminine In A Masculine World
body: Regardless of the gender you identify with, feminine and masculine energies exist within all of us. When the masculine energies become too strong like in today’s society, imbalances and malaise can result. Join Julia in this class to help strengthen your feminine energy and to bring more love and joy into your life.

title: Open Your Heart to Possibility
body: This class moves through a series of heart opening poses as we remind ourselves that the possibilities in our lives are many, regardless of where we are today.

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Lookout
body: For this final meditation in the series Busy Place, Quiet Mind, Fiji uses Gyan mudra for a grounding practice of turning inwards. She turns our attention towards the cyclical patterns all around us, encouraging us to reconnect to one cycle in particular - the breath.

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Alley
body: Settle yourself amidst the busy and focus the mind on the breath.  The inner teacher finds the way to calm the mind and settle the energy. It’s a beautiful gift!

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Nook
body: Jonni-Lyn leads this guided Japa meditation, using mala beads and mantra as a tools to assist the mind in concentration. Jonni shares a personal story about her experience with practicing meditation within a busy life. She creates this ten minutes of beautiful space for us to let go.

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Rooftop
body: This guided meditation invites us to embrace the busy world and the noise around us and use it as a pathway to meditation, rather than trying to create the “perfect” space for peace and reflection.

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Stairway
body: In this guided meditation with Tracey we take a moment, find a seat and settle into our breath. We change our perspective and look inside to the teacher within.

title: Busy Place, Quiet Mind: The Bridge
body: This meditation practice with Fiji allows you to drop deep into the centre of your being to find a place of stillness amid the chaos of everyday life.

title: Find Your Footing
body: Explore your inner leg line through forward folds, standing straddle, and gate pose. We will explore the connection to the deeper core muscles and open into a delicious gate twist.

title: Subtle Joint Movements
body: This Sukshma Vyayama with Sarada is the ancient system of yogic practices which loosens your joints and removes the energy blockages. The practice is safe, rhythmic, repetitive stretching movements.

title: Quick Morning Boost
body: Start your day off right, with this quick morning boost of yoga. A full class, including a short Pranayama practice and Asana, sequenced to get all of your body moving.

title: Flow with Ease
body: Stay low on the mat and open to the connection of breath and movement. Anchored in flow ~ wring out the shoulders, the hips and the hamstrings preparing you to settle into the deep rich posture of Frog.

title: How Sweet You Are
body:
This sensual, oozing class drips with backbends, fiery core holds, and poses that can best be described as amateur breakdancing poses. Come align yourself to the present moment.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Exploring Twists
body: In this class we’ll be continuing to explore twists and move into some deep stretches. This class will be a good challenge for beginner students.

title: Fallen Angel
body: Challenge yourself and build strength, in this energizing and fun class. With a focus on arm strength and arm balances, work your way mindfully into Fallen Angel or Devaduuta Panna Asana. This pose is a variation on revolved crow that is a fun and graceful pose to play with.

title: Power Core and More
body: In this advanced pilates class Kathi uses breath and strong cues to attend to the subtle core and back body. Beginning more gently with a warm up, Kathi gradually progresses through a variety of challenging core-engaging postures that will leave you feeling well connected and energized.

title: Balance and Motion
body: When we have established strong foundations we can navigate the twists and turns that come our way with ease and grace.  This flow builds from the foundations creates to move in and out of balancing sequences with confidence.

title: Fuel to the Fire
body: Integration and expansion are explored while we move through a strong standing sequence. Balance, inner focus and commitment to your foundation offers the fight from one standing pose to the next.

title: Get 'Er Done
body: This class goes up, this class goes down, this class goes backwards. It gives a little bit of everything, but focuses mainly on twists. It also involves some lovely flowing back bends .

title: Building Heat with Twists
body: This class will build some heat as we focus on twists. Expect some fun, new and novel movement patterns in this one! This class will be a good challenge for beginner students. Props: Please come prepared with any props to help you sit comfortably.

title: L Shape To Fly
body: This class works of the action “hugging into the mid-line”. Through this concept, we are able to gain strength and stability. We explore the same shape, in a few different variations, ending up at the wall in an inversion. Learn some key concepts that will help you in all of your practice.

title: Kickin' It Up
body: This class is a solid intermediate Pilates class to challenge your mobility and power.  Pushing you towards the last, even more, intense class in this series.

title: Foundations and Fire
body: Fiji continues to focus on steady strong foundations in this flow, while introducing some heat. Build strength and stamina from the foundation up, in this short but fiery practice.

title: Rest and Recover: Softness
body: Explore a somatic practice releasing tension throughout your body. Learn where you are holding tension and how to let it go. Relax, restore, replenish your body’s natural strength, vitality and resilience. Note: Two blankets, two pillows or cushions, and a small towel or eye pillow are recommended for this practice. Gather what you need to feel supported.

title: Feel Stronger, Be Softer
body: Discover the ease and effortlessness needed as you draw your power from the inside and connect to your core.Triangle and Fallen Triangle are paralleled gaining poise and play from our personal power centre.

title: Happy Hearts
body: This super-flowy class with Crista uses lots of transitions and builds towards deep backbends.

title: Twisty Yoga for Beginners
body: This beginner friendly class focuses on twisting poses with a dash of core work to wake up the midline.

title: Upper Body and Arm Balance
body: Work your way into crow pose, in this fun and challenging class. Discover what actions help to stabilize you, as well as what to strengthen, in order to lift up and fly into crow. Arm balances require not just arm strength, but work and support from the whole body! Leave this class feeling stronger and a little lighter.

title: Back to the Basics
body: Pushing the beginner level slightly to prepare you for our next Pilates class in this series.  Full body with strength, mobility, stability and stretch.

title: Form and Flow
body: This practice focuses on the foundations and form of our poses as we move in an intentional way through an invigorating sequence.

title: Rest and Recover: Spaciousness
body: Explore breathwork to quiet your mind, restore and replenish your body’s natural vitality.  Cultivate spaciousness and ease in restorative poses, releasing the daily accumulation of stress and tension.

title: Detox and Flow
body:
A flow based sequence focusing on elongation, decompression, compression and twists. Built upon repetition the body is prepared to cleanse both the body and the busi-ness of the mind.

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Slow and Low
body: Stay low and slow with me as we move through a gentle, deep release through your shoulders, spine, hips and lower back. Let your breath be your teacher while you lean in with curiosity and inquiry.

title: Yoga for a Strong, Healthy Spine
body: Flow into poses that strengthen your spine, increase flexibility and improve your posture. Explore spinal flexion, extension and rotation for a healthy spine. This short, simple flow includes breathwork guidance to increase mindful movement.

title: Forward Folds
body: This yin practice contains mainly forward folds for when your back feels tight and your head feels heavy. Take a few long hold stretches and allow the tension in your spine to melt away.

title: Strength and Stretch
body: Strengthen and stretch your whole body in this Yoga-Pilates Fusion class with Julia. Enjoy the core strength that pilates brings tempered by the smooth and calm of yoga.

title: Open Your Heart to Your Existence
body: In this class, we explore the space we take up and our right to expand into it without apology.

title: Yoga for Pain Care: Headaches and Migraine Relief
body: A gentle, therapeutic yoga and breath practice to support you, when you have a headache or migraine, as well as for preventative care.  Be guided in a slow deep breathing practice to reduce pain, and therapeutic yoga to release tension in your upper body, shoulders, and neck.

title: Will I Be Anxious Forever
body: Join David as he asks the candid question 'Will I be anxious forever?'. Many of those who experience chronic anxiety have lived with it as a constant part of their lives for so long that it can seem like it will never go away, like they can't imagine what life would be like without it. Curiosity and thoughtful exploration can trigger and sustain a shift away from chronic anxiety, creating epiphanies and moments of clarity. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Pranayama for Anxiety I
body: The busy mind that often accompanies chronic anxiety can make it difficult to meditate or calm your nervous system. In this short class, David shows you how you can use gentle pranayama to more effectively transition into a meditation practice.

title: Anxiety and Why Doing Nothing Can Help
body: In order to decrease their anxiety, many believe that they need to keep 'working at it'. In this video, David teaches you why it's more nuanced than that. Learning about your chronic anxiety requires a simple, careful, thoughtful approach. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: An Effective Daily Approach to Chronic Anxiety
body: We will never be able to let go of anxiety's grip if we can't understand the role we play to keep it there and empower it. It may contradict everything you believe about the anxiety and panic that you feel, but every single thought you have is affecting it. How can we take a look at the way we live our lives on a daily basis, with the intention to understand how we reinforce the anxiety and, in turn, how we can let it go. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Why Do We Call This Anxiety?
body: Have you ever asked yourself why the word anxiety exists and what exactly it is? It may seem like a silly question, but who's to know that everyone living with anxiety is experiencing something similar? If that's a possibility, than does the label even help? If it does, how? How is it serving you and how is it preventing you from letting go of it? Join David in this video to explore these important questions. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: What Role Does the Nervous System Play with Chronic Anxiety?
body: In this video, David helps you feel the effect of the nervous system on your life, and how it can lead to chronic anxiety and panic attacks. Understanding what the nervous system is doing when you get anxious helps you learn how to let go of its grip on your life. David finished by teaching you a simple practice that can be used anytime, anywhere, to help reduce the overwhelming effect of anxiety on your life. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: How Does The Energy In Your Body Teach You About Your Chronic Anxiety?
body: If you are serious about letting go of your chronic anxiety, one important step is to look inward. Among the many aspects that you can tune into is the activity in your nervous system, or the energy in your body. In this video, David teaches you how you can tune into that feeling within you no matter what you're doing, and learn to turn down the intensity of the activity within you, which feels out-of-control and overwhelming to so many of us. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: An Open Dialogue: Accepting Anxiety
body: David and Jeff sit down and have a honest conversation about their experiences with anxiety and how sharing, connecting with and accepting your anxiety are fundamental steps in the journey to overcoming this debilitating mental condition. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Evening Wind Down
body: A short sequence to help you wind down and destress from your day. Stretch out your tired body and get ready to relax.

title: Slow Power Flow: Free Flow
body: Guy invites you to flow freely, slowly and powerfully with your breath as he weaves you through a variety of familiar -- and not so familiar -- poses and sequences. A good one for getting the kinks out!

title: Gentle Back Mobility
body: A mellow practice designed to help you take care of your back. Appropriate for people with sore backs, this gentle practice will gently stretch and move your spine.

title: Core Burn
body:
A short and sweet core workout geared to help you engage your abs and feel a nice post-workout burn!

Need to take it down a notch? Explore the 2023 Beginner Yoga Journey here.

title: Yoga Pilates Fusion: Short and Sweet
body: Julia guides you through a series of pilates core exercises in this fun vinyasa practice. You’ll cover all the bases in this short class. Enjoy!

title: What is the IT band?
body: In less than 10 minutes Rachel discusses all things iliotibial (IT) band. She outlines how this band of connective tissue is essential for stability in the body, while also demonstrating a wonderful stretch to bring awareness to this complex area.

title: Post Run Stretch
body: Take a short stretch after your run. We will include mobility drills and stretches for all the major muscles involved in running.

title: Good Night Yin
body: This class with Helen is all about supporting a good night's sleep. We will use our breath and long slow Yin holds for deep stretching and relaxation, designed to send you right to bed.

title: Energize: Solar Flow
body: A short, simple energizing yoga flow. This yoga practice stretches and strengthens the muscles with a strong focus on breath and body alignment. Great practice wake-up your body and focus your mind as you kick start your day, or re-energize after work.

title: What is Neutral Spine?
body: In this short clip Julia explains what a ‘neutral spine’ is and how you can find it in your body while standing, lying down, and on all fours.

title: A Guided Meditation For Compassion
body: This meditation guides you through a full body scan with the offer to release judgement and draw on compassion. If you’d like to be kinder to yourself and your body, this one is for you. Please note: A bolster and/or blanket are optional for this practice.

title: Lush Forest Meditation
body: Allow Josh to guide you through this meditation where you will travel to a beautiful forest to find some rest and relaxation. Please support yourself with any props you may like to sit with.

title: Release Your Anger
body: Julia guides you through three ways to deal with anger and frustration in this class. You’ll work to get any bad energy moving and express it in a healthy way. Finish up with a healing light meditation to calm and re-energize you.

title: Handstand Workshop
body: We will move through a warm-up geared toward handstand, then Josh will talk you through doing handstand safely against the wall, followed by a short cool-down sequence. Please find some space at a wall for this workshop.

title: The Quick Pick Me Up
body: This class with Helen uses a combination of breath exploration and simple movement to shift stagnation and invite uplifting energy. Perfect for when you need a little boost!

title: Expanding Energy
body: To move with ease and grace is a guiding intention in our practice and will be a focus in this class. This is a fluid practice igniting the energy within and allowing it to to build and expand in our body, mind, and being. There are options in many of the poses to expand into more challenging variations allowing the practice itself to grow over time.

title: Core to the Floor
body: This class focuses on the core to earth relationship, rooting down to draw strength up into the centre of our being.  There is a mix of standing and supine core work that will fire you up from the inside out.

title: Bridge to Balance Meditation
body: This guided meditation is a sacred pause, emphasizing the importance of stopping along the way of any journey to take in the moment. Mudra and pranayama in this class help to restore the essential balance of Shiva and Shakti energy within us. Note: Seated support such as a blanket or cushion is recommended for this meditation.

title: Return to Roots
body: This practice invites us to return to our roots, our source of strength, stability, and balance.  Working with feet and hands to build a pose from the ground up.

title: Floating Triangle
body: We will do a full practice to warm up into a really fun sequence called the Floating Triangle Sequence. In this peak sequence, we will be using a lot of core and hip strength to move through poses where we are only supported on one leg. This will be a strong class, so modifications will be provided. Note: 2 blocks are recommended for this practice.

title: Meet Me Where You Are
body: Flow toward what feels good in your body, and notice the tension soften as we let go of the old patterns that hold us back. A playful, and subtle exploration of inner lines, spacious side body and our wonderful hips.

title: Seeking Space
body: In this practice Fiji will invite you to seek the space that already exists within you. In yoga we can focus too much on how to engage, but learning how to soften is also key. This practice will guide you into the space within your hips, legs, and spine so that energy can flow more freely.

title: Slow Power Flow: Creating Space
body: In this class, Guy explores how to find and feel space in our practice -- space in your body, space in your breath, and space in your mind. Prepare to open up in all directions!

title: Good Morning Yin
body: Though often associated with winding down, Yin Yoga is a fantastic way to introduce your body to the day ahead! In this class we will stretch out those sleepy kinks in both body and mind so that you can move into your day with space and ease.

title: Yoga for Runners
body: Designed with runners in mind, this hip opening practice targets the muscles that are so often tight with athletes: hamstrings, groin, hip flexors, and rotators. Complement your sport activities with this quick, yummy practice. Please note: Two blocks are optional for this class.

title: Slow Power Flow: Grounding
body: This class is all about establishing a solid foundation, particularly in standing postures, in order to bring greater stability and integrity to your practice. Guy uses his slow and powerful flow approach to help you learn how to tap into energy from the ground and draw this up into your core.

title: Opening into Wheel
body: Josh guides this sweet flow designed to warm you up into a full wheel. Enjoy backbending, spinal mobility, and some deep stretching!

title: Yoga for Casual Hikers
body: This class digs into the feet, legs and hips and is perfect for someone who needs a deep lower body stretch. It was designed with casual hikers and walkers in mind but works well for anyone wanting to focus on the lower body.

title: Keyboard Wrists
body: Josh spearheads this short sequence designed to stretch out the hands and wrists. Encompassing seated and table top positions, this is accessible to desk workers of all kinds. This practice is Part 2 of a series for computer workers. If you enjoy this class, please check out Part 1, Tech Neck.

title: WholesOMe Hatha
body: Sarada encourages attention to breath in this classical hatha practice, exploring traditional sun salutations, malasana squat, wide legged boat pose, and spinal twists. This class is available for everybody and every body!

title: Heels Over Head
body: Tracey rhythmically guides this playful integration of opening the back body, shoulders and lower back as we move through plough pose, shoulder stand and fish pose. On the subtle level this class encourages communication by addressing the throat chakra.

title: 40 Minute Restore
body: This restorative class has only 4 poses and savasana! Expect plenty of time to settle in and linger in the restorative shapes. This is a slow, cozy class. Note: Grab your favorite supportive props! Melissa suggests 2 blankets, one bolster, one chip block, and one eye pillow or scarf to cover your eyes.

title: Morning Awakening Flow
body: This all-levels class with Josh is designed to help your whole body wake up in the morning, paying special attention to the superficial backline which tends to get tight as we sleep . Set yourself up for an energized day!

title: Long Limber Lines
body: Explore the relationship between your hips, hamstrings and inner line. This practice creates a strong steady foundation that lifts our physical body and calms the busy mind.

title: I Am My Own Tree
body: This hip-opening class is both fiery and grounding, empowering and challenging, subtle yet strong. Squats, twists, and backbends, oh my!

title: Tech Neck
body: This short stretch sequence encourages people who work at computers to take a break from work and stretch out their neck. Josh skillfully weaves in some helpful tips for taking care of your neck at work. This class is Part 1 of a series for computer workers. If you enjoyed it, please check out Part 2 - Keyboard Wrists.

title: Just for Fun
body: Crista guides you through this full-body advanced vinyasa flow, offering a variety of challenging inversions and hand balance options.

title: Energy Orbit Meditation
body: Guy guides you gently through this breath-centred internal-energy awareness meditation. It focuses on developing a clear awareness of energy cycling down the front of your body and up the back of your spine, much like the Microcosmic Orbit in traditional Chinese medicine. This is a clearing and centering practice, intended to bring you calmness and clarity.

title: Yoga for Road Trips
body: Stretch out your tight muscles after hours spent in the car with this class geared specifically for road trips. It can be done at the side of the road or in a hotel room after a day of travel. No mat or props needed!

title: All Things Core
body: Our personal power centre lies in the belly. In this vinyasa flow class with Tracey, we begin on our back, work with the deeper muscles of the abdominals and keep the spark alive as we rise to our feet for an integrated flow.

title: Pilates Flex-Band: Short Class
body: Enjoy this short, pilates flex-band class with Julia where you’ll focus mainly on arm and breathwork with a touch of glutes and core. Note: A flex-band is required for this practice.

title: Yes, Grasshopper!
body: This intermediate flow experience with Rachel will prepare you for exploring one of yoga’s most entertaining arm balances: insect pose (tittibhasana). Along the way, we’ll explore hip opening, full splits, core work, wrist strengthening and some other fun hand balances. Come along for the ride!

title: Dancing Dervish
body: Channel your inner dervish in this heart-opening, side-bending, shoulder-stretching class with Crista. This intermediate vinyasa practice culminates with the transition of wild thing to wheel, and juicy hip-openers are included! Note: It is recommended to have blocks or a blanket for this practice however this is entirely optional.

title: Simple Counting Meditation
body: This practice is intended for people relatively new to the practice of meditation. Guy offers a simple method for training your awareness through the use of breath-counting, allowing you to drop behind the busyness of your mental thought-stream.

title: What Can Our Hips Teach Us?
body: In this class with Jonni-Lyn, we ask ourselves: What can our hips teach us? Can we open and go further, perhaps lifting into an arm balance? Or maybe we need to back off and give ourselves time and space. Through this practice we will start to open our hips with some sun salutations, standing poses and hip openers. We'll also explore an arm balance with these open hips and then move into our final relaxation and short seated meditation.

title: How to Do Astavakrasana (Eight-Angle Pose)
body:
Follow Rachel in this tutorial and learn her tips and techniques for practicing this fun hand balancing pose.

To learn more, check out Rachel's YTT course, Principles of Teaching 2 which is one of 32 courses that make up our online/in-person 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program.

title: Hip Tonic
body: Join Tracey in this vinyasa practice and rejuvenate your hip joints with a variety of hip movements and playful transitions as we explore balance and integration. Dynamic movements and static holds will lift us up and away into ardha chandrasana, also known as half moon pose, with space in the body and mind.

title: Flow to Slow
body: This intermediate yin/yang practice with Josh is 30 minutes of flow and 20 minutes of gentle relaxation. It's a great way to wind down your day with a good stretch and some mindful relaxation. Note: You will need two blocks for this class. A bolster is optional.

title: What Tadasana Can Tell You About Your Body
body: In this Yoga Explained video, you'll learn essential tips for practicing Tadasana, also known as Mountain Pose, effectively. Not only will this exploration revolutionize your understanding of Tadasana, it will also support you to cultivate your personal optimal alignment in every yoga pose.

title: Yoga for Tight Shoulders
body: If you have stiff or tight shoulders, this class is for you! Join Nyk as she takes you through a therapeutic yin yang practice focused on releasing tension in the upper back and shoulders.

title: Open to Opportunity
body:
This intermediate vinyasa practice with Fiji helps us open our body, mind and heart to the opportunities that show up everyday. Set yourself up for success in each pose and explore the levels to find your own growth each day.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 22 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Pranayama for Anxiety III
body: In David's third video on pranayama and chronic anxiety, he teaches you to use what you learned in Pranayama for Anxiety II to activate the nervous system, injecting your body and mind with energy and vitality and helping you focus more easily. A chronic state of anxiety can make you feel sluggish, so this technique is a powerful way to shift that heavy, exhausted feeling into something lighter and brighter. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Pranayama for Anxiety II
body: In this video on chronic anxiety, David teaches you to use what you learned in Pranayama for Anxiety I to calm the nervous system using pranayama and meditation. With practice, you can use this simple technique on your own to gradually release the grip that anxiety has on you. To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Pranayama for Anxiety I
body: The busy mind that often accompanies chronic anxiety can make it difficult to meditate or calm your nervous system. In this short class, David shows you how you can use gentle pranayama to more effectively transition into a meditation practice.
