To watch the rest of this video series, check out David's free Anxiety: A Learning Series. To go deeper into your relationship with your anxiety, go to David's Let Go of Anxiety and Fear 21-Day Program.

title: Integral Practice for Heart Opening
body: This integral heart opening yoga practice with Rachel combines all elements of the practice: kriya, asana, pranayama and meditation to create a full and well-rounded class experience. You’ll leave the practice feeling open, calm and refreshed.

title: How to Do Plank Pose Properly
body:
In this tutorial, Rachel breaks down the important alignment points to practice plank pose safely. By learning these fundamentals, you will also learn how to prepare your shoulders for more complex poses such as chaturanga, inversions, and hand balances. 

To learn more, check out Rachel's YTT course, Anatomy of the Shoulder which is one of 32 courses that make up our online/in-person 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program.

title: Our Own Life Has To Be Our Message
body: This class starts off with the quote “Our own life has to be our message” from Vietnamese monk Thich Nhat Hanh. We explore the idea that everything we do, on the mat and in the rest of our lives, is a reflection of our message and what is important to us. Join Jonni-Lyn for a quick paced vinyasa flow which gets into the hips and explores full lotus or padmasana in a few different positions. If full lotus is not in your practice, please use half lotus or easy pose/sukhasana. Always respect your knees!

title: Yoga for Upper Body Tension
body: This slow flow class with Melissa is ideal for those dealing with neck, shoulder and back tension. It is cooling, calming and relaxing so it can also be helpful if you have a headache. Note: You will need a bolster, blanket and block for this practice.

title: Cultivate Connection
body:
This practice with Fiji invites us to cultivate a deep connection with ourselves and listen to our intuition. The continuous flow weaves together mind, body, and breath.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Reset, Recalibrate, Revive
body: Join Tracey in this intermediate vinyasa flow class where standing balance, thoughtful transitions, and a sense of curiosity are interwoven through a series of postures designed to ground your energy, and calm your mind.

title: Pilates: Booty Boost
body: This intermediate pilates class with Julia is all about strengthening and giving the backside a little lift! Follow along with your breath and connect to your glutes.

title: Slow Flow with a Touch of Core
body: This gentle beginner practice with Melissa is a full body slow flow with a sprinkling of core work throughout. Note: You will need a block or pillow for this practice.

title: Shoulder Mobility
body: This intermediate practice with Josh is perfect for anyone who has stiff or tight shoulders. He guides you through a gentle, hatha yoga class with mindful movement designed to give you more shoulder mobility. Some therapeutic/rehabilitation movements will also be included.

title: A Mother's Day Livestream Just For Moms with Fiji McAlpine - May 9 @1015am PST
body:
This livestream yoga class took place on Sunday, May 9th.

Description: Fiji leads a 40 minutes intermediate flow that will leave you feeling energized and renewed.

This Mother’s Day we would like to honour and acknowledge the incredible Mothers in our DoYogaWithMe community. This past year has taken parenting to a whole new level that required more effort, patience and resilience. We want to fill your cup and nourish you on this special day; it is an opportunity for the nurturer to be nurtured!

title: A Mother's Day Livestream for Moms and Kids with Fiji McAlpine - May 9 @930am PST
body:
This livestream yoga class took place on Sunday, May 9th.

Description: Fiji leads a short and fun yoga class with her friend, Dakota. This is a class you can do with your kids.

This Mother’s Day we would like to honour and acknowledge the incredible Mothers in our DoYogaWithMe community. This past year has taken parenting to a whole new level that required more effort, patience and resilience. We want to fill your cup and nourish you on this special day; it is an opportunity for the nurturer to be nurtured!

title: Prenatal Yoga for Pelvic Pain and SPD
body: Julia guides you through gentle movements and stretches to help alleviate common pelvic pains associated with SPD (symphysis pubis dysfunction) in pregnancy. You’ll work to strengthen your pelvic floor and release the lower back, supporting you in the best way possible. Note: You will need a chair for this practice and having a block, blanket or bolster is optional.

title: Hands Free: Kick Your Asana, Part II
body:
This hands free class with Rachel is perfect for people working with shoulder, wrist and elbow injuries who still want a powerful and engaged practice. We will work through standing hip openers that strengthen and open the hips and legs. 

You can find Part One of this series here: Hands Free: Kick Your Asana, Part I.

title: Hands Free: Kick Your Asana, Part I
body:
Designed as a hands free practice, this class with Rachel is perfect for people working with shoulder, wrist and elbow injuries who still want a powerful and engaged practice. We will explore twists and lunges that engage and strengthen the legs, hips and spine. 

You can find Part Two of this series here: Hands Free: Kick Your Asana, Part II.

title: Pranayama: Adding Rhythmatic Life Force with Control
body:
Please help us welcome our newest instructor, Sarada Jagannath!

Join Sarada in this pranayama practice to learn four different types of ancient breathings techniques from hatha yoga and make it your way of life.

title: Let it Fall Away
body: Unwind, turn inward and together we will discover a little more about ourselves. In this power yoga practice with Tracey, we move through hip openers, honor the relationship between our hips and hamstrings, and playfully unlock the habitual layers of movement.

title: Morning Meditation and Stretch
body: Start your day off right with this relaxed morning stretch and meditation with Melissa. It's a short, full body beginner class that will get you moving, centered and ready to take on the day!

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Wake Up Yoga
body: Wake Up Yoga with Alyssa Jean is a sequence to shake the cobwebs from sleeping and create a renewed positive energy for everyone in the family. Beginning from a sleepy child’s pose, we make our way up to standing postures and sun salutations, ending with some restorative postures to leave the body feeling balanced and ready for the day.

title: Yoga for Hamstring Rehabilitation
body: Got a hamstring injury? Yoga is known as a flexibility practice, but what happens when you overstretch your hamstrings? Specifically designed for students who are working with a pulled hamstring or hamstring tendinopathy (often called, “yoga butt”), this class with Rachel will functionally strengthen your hamstrings and support your pathway to recovery. It is also an excellent class for students looking to cultivate lower body strength in general.

title: Yoga for Sleepy Heads
body: Not a morning person? Check out this yin to yang practice where Nyk flips the order of a traditional yoga class. She begins the class lying down, then moves you through seated poses into kneeling pose, and finishes the class in a standing posture ready to begin the day.

title: Crazy Eights with Josh Chen
body: This vinyasa flow class with Josh focuses on hip strengthening and core strength. Prepare to move through a playful and strong power sequence that builds to astavakrasana (also known as eight-angle pose), a challenging arm balance. Note: You will need two blocks for this practice.

title: Jivamukti Compass
body: Join Jonni-Lyn in this steady and strong flow as she guides you through a few hip openers; camel pose (ustrasana), reclined hero pose (supta virasana) and headstand. Once your hips are happy and open, you will spend a bit of time exploring compass pose (parivrtta surya yantrasana).

title: Tapas and Transformation
body:
This vigorous flow with Fiji stokes the inner fire with core work and challenging asanas. The inner fire helps us shed that which holds us back and gives us courage to step into something new.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: How to Do Side Crow
body:
In this six minute tutorial, Rachel shows you some tips and techniques for playing with a more difficult variation of the crow pose: side crow (parsva bakasana). 

To learn more, check out David and Rachel's YTT courses, Introduction to the Bandhas, Anatomy of the Core and Anatomy of the Shoulder which are three of 32 courses that make up our online/in-person 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Calmness
body:
Are you feeling agitated or irritable and needing a break from yourself? In this gentle beginner practice, Guy helps you to use simple, slow and mindful movements to bring yourself to a place of calm and equanimity. Note: It is recommended that you use a bolster or cushion for elevating your hips while sitting.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Pleasure
body:
Allowing your body to move towards the sensations of pleasure is the same as allowing your body to move in the direction of healthiness. In this class, Guy explores the use of pleasure in your yoga practice as a way of moving towards better health.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Energy
body:
In this fusion yoga class, Guy blends yoga and qi gong to offer you a practice that will connect you with the feeling and flow of energy within your own body. Enjoy this delicious and nourishing practice!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Vitality
body:
This class is about building a quiet and clear sense of internal energy, putting yourself in a place of readiness to move through your daily life with purpose, ease and confidence. 

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Strength
body:
Maintaining your strength as you age is key to lifelong health. In this beginner practice, Guy uses his slow flow style to lead you through a series of strengthening poses aimed at maintaining your overall bodily health.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Clarity
body:
Amongst the classical eight limbs of yoga is one limb devoted exclusively to the ability to focus and sustain your concentration. In this class, Guy offers a practice that will encourage you to practice focusing on a specific aspect of each pose, with the aim of developing your ability to stay attentive and clear in daily life.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Mental Fitness
body:
Have some fun in this class as Guy guides you through a series of mentally stimulating cross-body movements. These movements are aimed at activating and building neural pathways between the two hemispheres of your brain.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

title: Yoga for Lifelong Mobility
body:
“Mobility” refers to your ability to use your body with strength and ease through a full range of motion. This class with Guy focuses on improving the mobility of your body using active engagement of your muscles while stretching. Prepare to do a bit of work … and to feel better as a result!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 9 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men or Day 1 of Guy's 8-Day Yoga for Life-Long Wellness Program.

Yoga for Lifelong Mobility Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below at the 2:30 minute mark of the video to sync it with the class.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Postnatal Pilates: Rebuilding the Core
body: After the initial 8 weeks of recovery post-delivery, get back to the mat and connect to your core with Julia. She’ll guide you through safe core exercises for this time of your life.

title: Yoga Explained: Loops and Warrior II Pose (Virabhadrasana II)
body:
Join David for a close analysis of Warrior II Pose (Virabhadrasana II), as he uses the concept of loops to describe how to direct your energy and establish a strong foundation and a solid connection to stability and your core.

To explore this concept further, check out Fiji's YTT course Cueing 1 - Position or Rachel's course Cueing 2 - Actions.

title: Self-Love for Kids and Families
body: This class for kids and families focuses on self-love and self-acceptance, two important concepts for all of us, especially children. The central theme and approach comes from VbE (Values-Based Education), a system which emphasizes the many values that we all strive to embody in our lives and relationships.

title: Pilates: Core Burn
body: Short on time? Get serious about your core work with Julia in this quick and efficient 15-minute class! No props needed.

title: Yoga Explained: Reciprocal Inhibition
body: As long as you are moving, reciprocal inhibition is active. It's an important nervous system response that turns off certain muscle groups when others are active, allowing your body to move with little resistance. Understanding how reciprocal inhibition works can also help you move in a more relaxed way and improve flexibility more quickly. In this video, David shows you how.

title: Glute Blast
body: This practice with Josh is a strong vinyasa class to wake up your glutes. We will open and strengthen the hips in poses like half moon and side plank. Stronger options will be offered.

title: Balance the Currents of Life
body: Join Tracey and settle into the cadence, the pace and rediscover the warrior within. Through warrior poses, gentle twists, and integrated movement you will unleash your power, your strength, and your fearlessness. You’ve got this!

title: Slow Power Flow
body: In this intermediate level class, Guy takes his usual slow flow up a notch, bringing in more challenging shapes and longer holds. Prepare for your slow burn!

title: The Butterfly Practice
body: Join Crista in this full-body class that uses unique transitions and movements to strengthen and open your body to work towards seated bird of paradise. The practice also includes options for inversions and backbends.

title: A Strong Foundation
body:
In this power yoga class with Tracey, strong roots and deep integration are explored through repetition and flow. With a focus on hands, feet and core, this practice offers familiarity and steadiness in all postures. 

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Inversion Buffet
body:
In this invigorating and upbeat inversion extravaganza, Rachel takes you through an exploration of all the key inversions: handstand, forearm stand, headstand, and shoulderstand. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge.

title: Shoulderstand Variations
body:
Shoulderstand is known in yoga lore as a powerful and restorative posture. In this class (and in a welcome change of pace for our inversion series), Rachel guides you through an easeful approach to shoulderstand and we will explore how you can modify this pose and incorporate it into your practice. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge.

title: Headstand Exploration
body:
One of the most iconic yoga poses, headstand has long been thought to provide countless benefits for its practitioners. In this class with Rachel, we mindfully explore how you can begin to practice this lovely pose. Practitioners with neck issues are advised to practice the preparatory pose (keep the head off the floor). Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge.

title: Advancing to Forearm Balance
body:
In this shoulder opening practice, you will begin to warm up and educate your body to approach our peak pose, forearm stand. This exquisitely powerful inversion is similar to handstand, but also requires both heart opening and strength through the upper back and shoulders. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge.

title: How to Do a Handstand
body:
Rachel leads you through this intermediate practice where you will move to a peak pose of handstand, working step by step through the stages you need to do to practice this playful inversion safely. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge.

title: Preparing for Handstand
body:
In this practice, Rachel guides you to a peak pose of handstand prep pose where you will begin to cultivate the shoulder and upper awareness that is essential for supporting yourself properly upside down. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class, as Day 2 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge or as Day 28 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Setting the Foundation
body:
In this practice with Rachel, we will set the foundation for developing a safe and effective inversion practice. This class targets key areas of the body for inversions: wrists, shoulders, hips, core, and hamstrings. Note: You will need a wall to do the practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class, as Day 1 of Rachel's 7-Day Inversion Challenge or as Day 5 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Restorative Yin
body: This beginner class with Josh is a very gentle practice with long holds in restorative poses and gentle stretches. A short meditation is included before savasana. Note: You will need two blocks and a bolster for this practice.

title: Get a Little Wild
body:
This practice with Tracey is a warm and juicy flow. It prepares the hips and core for a little wild thing play, and the playful lift up, up and away into galavasana (also known as flying pigeon).

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Prenatal Yoga: The Basics
body: Join Julia as she guides you through different postures to help with the physical side of pregnancy. You will stretch and strengthen those most affected areas during the prenatal period, and set yourself up for a positive recovery during the postnatal period. Note: You will need two blocks and a bolster. Blankets are optional for this practice.

title: How Should I Practice If I’m Hypermobile?
body:
Rachel Scott discusses the challenges of practicing yoga for those of us who are hypermobile. She offers a simple approach to asana that mitigates hypermobility and helps prevent overextension.

To learn more, check out Rachel and David's YTT courses, Anatomy of the Knee and Anatomy Of Muscles And Connective Tissue which are two of 32 courses that make up our online/in-person 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program. You can also take a look at Rachel's free video, Anatomy of Connective Tissue: Learn Yoga Anatomy.

title: Super Supine: Practice Yoga Lying Down
body: Practice yoga - without ever leaving the ground! This relaxing and restorative yoga class with Rachel takes you through a gentle strengthening and hip opening practice that you can do (mostly) on your back. It's the perfect class for students who would prefer not to put weight on their hands. Note: You will need a wall and strap for this practice.

title: Practicing Self-Care
body:
This is the first video in our Values-Based Education (VbE) series. To learn more about VbE, click here.

This quick class with Ron is designed to stimulate the parasympathetic nervous system through slow breath and simple stretches of the neck and torso, reducing stress and anxiety while increasing awareness of calm and rested. Note: A chair or bolster is optional for this practice.

title: Prenatal Yoga: Celebrate
body: This beginner class is all about celebrating your growing, changing body! Julia gets you moving and stretching in this class, hoping to empower you, encourage you, and help you prepare for labor. Note: You will need two blocks, a bolster and a fun playlist is optional for this class!

title: Quick Morning Flow
body:
Join Jonni-Lyn for this short but full practice to start your day off right! It includes the pranayama’s of kapalabhati and nadi shodhana, a warm up, sun salutations, a few asanas to energize you, followed by savasana and seated meditation. Note: This practice is intermediate/advanced as the pranayamas are not taught in detail but lead.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 9 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Rest and Recover: The Power of Breath
body: Explore breathwork to strengthen two powerful energy centres: your navel centre, the body’s energy power-house, and your heart centre, the seat of unconditional love. Relax into a supported heart-opening backbend, then soften into sweet Shavasana. Please note: 2 blankets, 2 pillows or cushions, and a small towel or eye pillow are recommended for this practice.

title: Salute the Sun
body:
This vinyasa practice with Josh is a quick work out that features three types of sun salutations while providing modifications where necessary. It's the perfect way to warm up and wake up to your day, or to work up a quick sweat!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 14 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Salute the Sun Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Restorative Yoga for Self-Care
body:
Often we are so busy taking care of others that we forget to care for ourselves. You can not pour from an empty cup. In this class, Nyk guides you through a nourishing restorative practice, interwoven with a self metta (loving-kindness practice) to recharge your batteries and reconnect with yourself. Note: You will need a few props for this class.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 14 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

Restorative Yoga for Self-Care Full Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Core Fusion Flow
body:
This short fusion class incorporates pilates style exercises to build strength and increased awareness of your pelvic floor and deep abdominals. While this challenging class is beginner friendly it is also a good fit for anyone with a stronger practice that wants to build more strength around their pelvis, hips, hamstrings, abdominals and lower back.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Pelvic Flexibility and Health
body:
Join Ron in this beginner hatha flow class that focuses on stretching through the hips and pelvis, while working with moola bandha root lock, and breath, to release holding patterns and find more freedom.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Core Fusion Flow
body:
This short fusion class with Melissa incorporates pilates style exercises to build strength and increased awareness of your pelvic floor and deep abdominals. While this challenging class is beginner friendly, it is also a good fit for anyone with a stronger practice that wants to build more strength around their pelvis, hips, hamstrings, abdominals and lower back. 

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Backbody Awareness
body:
During yoga, people are often more aware and active in the front of their bodies than the back of their bodies. This hatha class with Josh will have an emphasis on bringing more life and sensation to the back half of your body, inviting more space and sensation into your yoga experience.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 12 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Backbody Awareness Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Yoga for the Upper Back
body:
This class is a deep release for the shoulders and upper back, making it perfect for a variety of people, including musicians, new parents, office workers and athletes. It targets all of the muscles connecting to the upper back and shoulders, providing relief from tightness, aches and pain... all in less than 40 minutes!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 12 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

Yoga for the Upper Back Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

title: Yoga Workouts for Men: Upper Body
body:
Guy’s 'Yoga Workouts for Men' offer a powerful, clear and accessible approach for men to engage in the physical practices of yoga. This 20-minute practice focuses on building strength and mobility in the upper body, including arms, shoulders and upper back.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 11 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Yoga Workouts for Men: Upper Body Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below at the 2:00 minute mark of the video to sync it with the class.

title: Meditation 101
body:
Starting a meditation practice can be really daunting but it doesn’t have to be. In this practice, Nyk explains what meditation is and isn’t, and how simple it is to get started with a grounding meditation practice. Note: You may want to have a bolster, block, cushion or blanket to sit on.

There is no playlist for this meditation.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 11 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Maintaining Center, Finding Balance
body:
In this hatha flow yoga class with Ron, we will connect movement to breath and practice yin and yang polarities which help us to measure ease and effort in our practice while we explore the sweet spot in single leg balances.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 10 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: Side Stretches and Twists
body:
This satisfying hatha yoga class with Melissa combines two great movements for your spine - side stretching and twists. You’ll feel so good (and tall!) after this class. It’s especially great for those that spend a lot of time on the computer and/or sit for long periods of time.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 10 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Self-Study
body:
This class with Guy is a slow full-body flow class reinforcing and reflecting on your own yoga practice. A key practice in traditional yoga is to observe your own inner patterns so that you can leave behind unproductive conditioning, preferences and aversions. This practice involves a continuous gentle focus on your breathing throughout the class.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 9 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Grounding Yourself
body:
This gentle hatha flow class with Josh is a slow-paced, breath-focused practice intended to get you out of your head and into your body. There will be an emphasis on mindful movement and body awareness. Note: It is recommended to have two blocks for this practice however this is entirely optional.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: The Fundamentals of Backbends
body:
In this beginner class with Rachel, we will explore the key actions necessary to practice backbending postures safely and effectively. You will learn how to stabilize your lower back in order to properly and safely explore these wonderful heart opening postures. Note: A strap is optional for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Fierce Posture Flow
body:
Get ready to bring out your fierce and focused self in this fun hatha yoga class with Guy as he guides you through a flowing sequence of powerful poses, including warriors, archers, and wild boars!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: Yin Yoga for Grounding
body:
Take a break from moving and flowing to settle into stillness. In this practice, Nyk guides you through a full-body yin sequence that's designed to create a sense of groundedness in your body from your head to your toes. Note: You will need two blankets and two blocks for this class.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

Yin Yoga for Grounding Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music

title: Movement as Meditation
body:
This delicious and deliberate class with Guy uses a classical approach to dissipating physical and mental agitation and lethargy so that you can rest in clarity during meditation. It starts with a full-spectrum physical practice, followed by an extended savasana, and then into a breath practice and a final meditation. This is a great way to use your own body and breath to calm and center yourself, while fully experiencing the meditative shift from “doing” to “being”.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

Movement as Meditation Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below at the 2 minute mark of the video to sync it with the class.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Softening the Hips
body:
Our ability to articulate our hips is in part dependent on our ability to release hip flexors. This class with Ron will start seated on a chair, where we can first feel a softening of the hips. Standing postures will further explore articulation and ease of working with the hips. Note: A chair or bolster is optional for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: Yoga Workouts for Men: Lower Body
body:
Guy’s 'Yoga Workouts for Men' offer a powerful, clear and accessible approach for men to engage in the physical practices of yoga. This practice provides a great way to build mobility in your lower body, both strengthening the muscles of the hips and legs, and improving their range of motion.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: A Whole Body Relaxation
body:
In this short and sweet guided relaxation with Josh, we will walk through the entire body and encourage relaxation and rejuvenation. Note: A bolster or cushion is optional for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Do Your Best
body:
This practice with Guy is short and sweet with a bit of challenge, allowing you to focus on doing the best you can — and no more!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Continue to Lighten Up: Make Yoga Your Friend
body:
In this beginner yoga class with Satiya, we will continue to explore the basics of yoga, body flexibility and movement. Satiya guides you through a gentle lower body workout routine while accessing the breath in relation to the movements. You can find Part One of this series here: Lightening Up Your Body.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

title: Stretch and Strengthen
body:
In this accessible class, Guy leads you through the primary movements of major joints in your body, focusing on both stretching and strengthening the muscles that support your joints. This is a good all-around practice to get you moving comfortably!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: The Fundamentals of Standing Poses
body:
In this hatha yoga class with Rachel, we will explore the key actions necessary to practice standing postures safely and effectively. We will explore the actions of the hips in foundational poses such as warrior II so that you can learn to do these poses optimally for your own body. Note: We recommend using a block for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

The Fundamentals of Standing Poses Full Playlist (to be played with the class)

title: Beginning Flow
body:
This slow flow beginner class with Guy is a fluid and flowing, highly breath-centered practice intended to uplift your energy and give you clarity as you face your day. Note: It is recommended to have a block for this practice however this is entirely optional.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

title: Slow Burn
body:
In this class suitable for all levels, Josh guides you through a slow-paced yoga practice that focuses on awakening and energizing your core muscles. Note: You will need two yoga blocks for this practice.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

title: A Full-Body Flow for Beginners
body:
This gentle practice with Melissa is a full-body slow flow that will leave you feeling calm and grounded. You can use this relaxation practice any time of the day. Note: You will need a block or cushion to sit on.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 of Grounding and Strength 14-Day Beginner Yoga Challenge.

A Full-Body Flow for Beginners Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Lightening Up Your Body
body:
Will yoga work for you? To answer this question, Satiya will take you through the very basic elements of yoga in relation to your body. First, we will establish muscle flexibility and as the series goes on, we work with body alignment to properly practice posture without causing injury.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 of Total Body Flexibility And Health 14-Day Yoga Challenge For Men.

Looking for more of a challenge? Check out the 14-Day Intermediate Challenge here.

Lightening Up Your Body Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Yin Yoga for Happy Hips
body: Do you have tight hips? This is very common when sitting for long periods of time but they can also be tight for so many other reasons. In this yin yoga practice, Nyk guides you through a practice to make even the tightest hips happy. Note: You will need a few props for this class. A bolster is optional.

title: Happy Hips with a Dash of Sugarcane Spice
body: This fun vinyasa flow with Jonni-Lyn will leave your hips open and happy, and your heart peaceful and quiet. There are a few different hip openers throughout the class, as well as ardha chandra chapasana, also known as sugarcane pose, to open you up. You have the option of coming into full wheel from wild thing, to spice things up a bit and a vashistasana variation. The practice ends with some pranayama and a short meditation.

title: Yin Yoga for Spine Health
body: This practice is designed to improve mobility, nourish the spine and create a sense of spaciousness in the body. In this intermediate yin yoga class, Nyk guides you through a practice focused on the key movements of the spine. Forward bends, backbends, lateral extension and twists are all included in this class.

title: Turning Off The Lights Meditation
body: This short beginner practice with Josh is a guided visualization and meditation designed to help you de-stress and bring down your level of anxiety and worry. It's also a perfect class to prepare your body for a good night’s sleep.

title: Life and Transitions
body:
Join Jonni-Lyn for this short, mindful yoga practice. The focus is moving with slow, mindful movements through the transitions of the poses. When the inhalation begins, the movement begins. When the exhalation begins, the movement begins. Each mindful movement is counted for five breaths with as much controlled movement as you can. You have the option to place your knees down on the floor for chaturangas, if needed.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 14 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Life and Transitions Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Skills of the Serpent
body:
Sharpen your senses to backbend with integrity and intelligence while increasing mobility in the spine through undulating movement in this sensuous practice with Andrea.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge or as Day 17 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Skills of the Serpent Playlist (to be played with the class)

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Sweet and Spicy
body:
This fun vinyasa flow practice with Crista has lots of juicy twists, side planks, and, of course, some delicious core work. Satisfy your appetite by working towards side crow pose (parsva bakasana) with one forearm down. No props required for this class.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 12 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Sweet and Spicy Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Intuitive Edge
body:
Learn to listen to the whispers of wisdom that emerge when the sensation and thought harmonize in the body in this 30-minute vinyasa flow with Fiji. The inner voice informs us without ego or fear, asking us to lean in just a bit deeper or to ease back for another breath.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 11 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Intuitive Edge Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Rising Phoenix
body:
Rise from the ashes to reclaim your confidence and resilience. In this class, Andrea breaks down the necessary elements to rise up into bird of paradise: inner thigh opener, internal shoulder rotation, core strength, and transitional balancing. Note: A strap is optional for this practice. As well as a blanket or block for knee support.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 10 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Rising Phoenix Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Exploring Your Patterns
body:
This practice is two practices in one. The first round is holding each pose for one breath as we move through the sequence and the second round is holding the same poses but for ten breaths each time. We move through the sun salutations slowly, counting the full five breaths for each movement. The challenge in this class is not the poses but rather noticing the mind and our resistance to doing things differently.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 9 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Exploring Your Patterns Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Warrior Integration
body:
Honor the strength, grace and balance within. This 60-minute vinyasa flow class with Tracey is an exploration and integration of all three warrior postures (warrior I, II and III), and provides modifications where necessary.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 8 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Warrior Integration Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Stand Like A Cedar
body:
Our steadiness and ease comes from a solid, strong foundation, from that foundation we can dance in the winds of life. Join Fiji in this intermediate practice and remember your roots in a variety of standing balances while learning to be solid and supple in each pose.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Stand Like A Cedar Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Big Bear Hugs
body:
Satisfy your inner growl with balances, twists, hip openers, and work towards eagle leg side crow in this intermediate vinyasa flow practice with Crista. Hug it out and let it all in.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Big Bear Hugs Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below and press play when the class begin

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Turning Inwards
body:
In this slow, deliberate practice, retreat into your inner sanctuary. Join Andrea and explore opening your inner thighs and hamstrings towards kurmasana, also known as turtle pose. Note: Feel free to use a blanket or block for knee support.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Turning Inwards Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Freedom Flow
body:
Get your whole body moving in this vinyasa flow practice with Fiji that aims to free up stuck or stagnant energy through intentional movement and breath. Leaving you feeling energized, this intermediate class is the perfect way to begin your day.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Freedom Flow Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Arrive Again
body:
Our mat is a place to practice arrival; in the moment, in our body and in our spirit. This slow flow with Fiji will flood our being with sensation and breath to invite our mind to arrive again and again.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Arrive Again Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

 

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Moving with Breath
body:
The best teacher is our breath. In this power yoga class with Tracey, we will plant the seed of listening to the movement guided by breath and open to the inquiry underneath the shapes and postures we build.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Moving With Breath Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on playlist below and press play when the class begins.

 

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Freedom in the Wings
body:
With a focus on arm positions, this intermediate practice with Ron will offer yogis the opportunity to explore arm placement in postures as a way to: help maintain balance, increase shoulder mobility, understand more options for modifying postures to create more ease, or challenge!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class, as Day 1 of Cultivate Your Inner Teacher 14-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge or as Day 12 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

Freedom in the Wings Playlist (to be played with the class)

Click on the playlist below and press play when the class begins.

Note: You will need a subscription for access to Apple Music, and for music to play ad-free on Spotify and YouTube Music. You will also need to adjust the volume to your preference.

title: Wrist Free Vinyasa, Part II
body:
This wrist free vinyasa class with Jonni-Lyn offers standing poses, hip openers, balancing poses and forward folds, all done without any pressure on the wrists. Jonni-Lyn shows you how you can be light on the fingertips - or simply hover them off the ground - and still maintain your balance, allowing you to practice for the days when you cannot (or choose not to) place weight on your wrists!

You can find Part One of this series here: Wrist Free Vinyasa, Part I.

title: Morning Stretch Flow
body:
Please help us welcome our newest instructor, Josh Chen!

Did you wake up stiff this morning? This quick sequence with Josh will get you going for your day. Prepare to move through a full-body stretch designed to get the sleepies out! Note: You will need two blocks for this practice.

title: Wrist Free Vinyasa, Part I
body:
This class is perfect for those who are unable to do wrist-intensive poses. Flow through this energizing yet peaceful class with Jonni-Lyn that has all the fun of vinyasa without the need of your wrists.

You can find Part Two of this series here: Wrist Free Vinyasa, Part II.

title: Prenatal Yoga: Breathe
body: This short practice with Julia is all about the lungs, oxygen and prana! As space becomes limited in our bodies, it’s important to take time to breathe for ourselves and for baby. You can try it seated on a chair or on your mat.

title: A Balanced Approach
body: This intermediate vinyasa flow with Tracey is a full spectrum practice that focuses on our connection to the midline and includes the front, back, upper, lower and both sides of our body. No props needed here!

title: Calm in the Chaos Livestream with Fiji McAlpine -  Nov 7 @9am PST
body:
This interactive livestream took place on Saturday, Nov 7th and begins with Jeff and Fiji giving an in-depth break down of each day of the program. At around 35 minutes, they begin taking questions from students.

Description: This is Day 7 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program and this very special program will culminate in a livestream with Jeff and Fiji featuring a live Q&A.

title: Trust Transformation
body:
Fire up some of your own internal flames in this intermediate vinyasa flow practice. Fiji begins with a seated kapalabhati breath meditation, followed by a warm up before moving into a combination of challenging postures and transitions. This class finishes with a sweet and relaxing savasana.

This class is Day 6 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

It is also Day 14 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Rise Again
body:
Explore how to rise with courage and strength in this invigorating practice with Fiji that includes lots of standing and arm balances.

This class is Day 5 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

title: The Eye That Guides You
body:
Awaken your third eye in this dynamic, intermediate practice with Fiji. She takes you through a challenging vinyasa flow that works the whole body and finishes the class with a third eye chakra meditation.

This class is Day 4 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

title: Vision Quest
body:
In this powerful and vigorous practice, Fiji begins the class by warming the body with vinyasa flow and focuses on standing balances, hips and backbends.

This class is Day 3 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

title: Flow into the Unknown
body:
All we can do is meet the moment. This intermediate practice with Fiji teaches us to be on our toes, literally sometimes. We move into discomfort, explore the edges with curiosity never knowing exactly where we will end up.

This class is Day 2 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

title: Eye of the Storm Meditation
body:
This meditation with Fiji will focus on the breath, to notice the inhale, the exhale, the continuous flow, two parts to the whole. We start by finding unity in our breath and we use that awareness to find unity within ourselves. Exploring the physical body, the emotional body, the mental body, the energetic body, the wisdom body that connects us to all others.

This class is Day 1 of Fiji's Calm in the Chaos program. Each class is very similar in style and movement, the intention and focus is what sets them apart as a progression.

title: Cultivate Your Inner Focus - Now Ready!
body:
This was originally a livestream that was converted into a regular yoga class.

Description: A 60-minute flow based practice tapping into our body’s inner wisdom. Mudra, breathwork and asana will be explored as we slide away from overstimulation and return to the self-guidance led from our heart center. All levels welcome!

title: Creating Space
body: Slow down and create space within. This class with Tracey is a gentle and dedicated focus on opening the shoulders, hips and side body to support the arm balance of bakasana, also known as crane (crow) pose, and the playful side of our practice.

title: Crow Pose Explained
body:
This tutorial with Tracey breaks down crow pose and teaches you how to effectively control your body weight with your hands. Remember that practice makes progress.

If you would like to learn more about the core strength needed to get into Crow Pose, check out two of David's YTT courses, Introduction to the Bandhas and Anatomy of the Core.

title: Yoga for Families: Concentration and Focus
body:
This yoga class is for families and kids ages 5 to 12. Alyssa Jean begins this practice with connecting the breath to movement, warming up the body and using strong warrior, balancing and core strengthening postures to keep the drishti throughout the practice, ending with some cooling restorative postures. 

Drishti in Sanskrit means, looking into one single point to find concentration.

title: Mind Medicine
body: Gift yourself the time to slow down and press pause for a few moments. Move methodically and steady your focus in this mind centered practice with Tracey, based in a meditation and movement.

title: Prenatal Yoga: Meditations
body:
Please help us welcome our newest instructor, Julia Crouch!

Julia guides you through two meditations to help prepare you for labor and to connect to your body and baby. The first is a kundalini-style practice for practical experience that books cannot provide when it comes to laboring and the second is a loving visualization to help you calm and connect. No props are needed and the class can be done seated if need be.

title: Gateway to Gratitude
body: Dial back the busy and reconnect to the moment with this 30-minute practice with Tracey. A slow flow with honoring gentle twists and forward folds. If you listen closely enough, you might be able to hear Tracey's heart beat on and off throughout this practice.

title: Shoulder Stability, Part II
body:
In David's second video on shoulder stability, he teaches you how to build strength in the muscles that are designed to provide stability for the shoulders. If you have not yet watched the first video in this series, go here.

To learn more, check out Rachel's YTT course, Anatomy Of The Shoulder, which is one of 32 courses that make up our Level 1 and 2 online, 250-hour YTT program.

title: Shoulder Stability, Part I
body:
Using anatomy and sensation, David teaches you how to engage the muscles around the shoulder girdle, upper back and chest in a way that effectively stabilizes the shoulders when bearing weight. Learning this is essential, especially when practicing poses like plank and chaturanga. This video is part 1 of a 2-part series. In the next video, you will learn how to safely build strength in those muscles. 

To learn more, check out Rachel's YTT course, Anatomy Of The Shoulder, which is one of 32 courses that make up our Level 1 and 2 online, 250-hour YTT program.

title: Self-Grounding Meditation
body: Take a short break in your day to reconnect with yourself in this calm, self-grounding meditation with Satiya. Note: You can do this meditation from any seated position, so feel free to find yourself a bolster, cushion or anything else that will help you find comfort and ease.

title: Slow Stretch Flow
body: This slow-paced, stretchy flow class with Jonni-Lyn is the perfect way to connect with your breath and tune in to your body. With lots of rolling movements, a focus on hip-opening and seated postures, this class will have you slow down and loosen up. It begins with the Guru mantra, chanting to the “Guru” which is the remover of darkness. The second chant is done with the classical sun salutations and was traditionally done with each movement to give thanks to the sun for rising each day and shining on us all.

title: Gentle Yoga for Reducing Anxiety
body: This beginner floor class was designed by Melissa to help you reduce your anxiety and/or stress. She guides you through a safe and thorough practice, with lots of gentle stretching for the whole body. Note: These props are optional but we recommend having a block or something else you can comfortably sit on.

title: Flow to Slow with Fiji McAlpine and Satiya Channer
body: This holistic practice is the best of both worlds, yang and yin. Fiji starts the class off with a warming intentional flow, then Satiya slows things down with some longer sweet holds. No props needed for this special class!

title: Yoga for Kids 5 to 10: Bedtime Yoga Routine
body: It can be difficult to switch into bedtime mode. This Yoga for Bedtime class with Alyssa Jean is a sequence that moves from a place of higher energy to a sense of calm and relaxation. Beginning with standing postures and slowly making your way to a laying down position, this practice gets you ready for your family’s next bedtime routine.

title: Yoga for Families: Let Go of Worry and Anxiety
body: This yoga class is for families and kids ages 9-16. Anxiety happens when we want to know the answer to everything, all at once. Join Alyssa Jean in this calming yoga practice for kids and families that will help slow down the quick moving thoughts, so that we can come back to the present. We begin slow, gentle breathing, which alone can calm anxiety. Alyssa Jean also explores balancing postures for focus, warrior postures for empowerment and finishes with restorative postures for a sense of lasting calm.

title: Align Your Heart and Mind Livestream with Tracey Noseworthy - Sept 19 @9am PST
body:
This livestream yoga class took place on Saturday, Sept 19th. Tracey introduces the class at around 5 minutes, the class begins at 6 minutes and ends at 1hr 9 minutes.

Description: Self-nourishment and self-love are explored in this devotional practice with Tracey. Dare to trade intellect for intuition and allow yourself to connect back to the originality, strength, wisdom and resourcefulness of your Heart.

title: Restorative Shoulder and Chest Opener
body: This gentle, relaxing restorative practice with Tianne is designed to open the chest and release tension in your shoulders. We will deepen the practice by exploring dirga pranayama, also known as 3-part breath; calming mind, improving digestion, lung health and deeper sleep. All levels welcome. Note: You will need a bolster and a few blankets for this practice.

title: Jivamukti: Fast and Fiercer
body: Join Jonni-Lyn in this fun, challenging jivamukti-inspired flow class that includes inversions, backbends, hip-openers and more! This full body practice is a follow-up to Jonni-Lyn's popular class, Jivamukti: Fast and Fierce.

title: Step by Step Cobra Pose
body:
Fiji unpacks the key elements of this deceptively simple backbend that is the cornerstone posture for practicing safe backbends and developing a strong and stable back body.

To learn more about how the spine functions in poses like this one, check out Fiji's online course, Anatomy of the Spine, which is one of 30 courses that make up our online/in-person 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program.

title: Spinal Strength and Flexibility
body: Spinal health is vital to the health of your whole body. This beginner class with Tianne will help strengthen and lengthen your spine, as well as increase spinal flexibility. The slow but deep practice focuses on both gentle and dynamic back strengthening poses, moving with deep breath awareness and completing with a restorative, healing savasana.

title: Loving-Kindness Meditation
body: Loving-kindness meditation, also known as “metta” meditation, is a great way to cultivate kindness for ourselves, our loved ones, community and the world at large. In this meditation practice, Nyk guides you through sending goodwill, kindness and warmth by silently repeating a series of mantras. Note: We recommend using a bolster, block, chair or blanket to sit on.

title: Stir It Up Livestream with Fiji McAlpine -  Aug 31 @9am PST
body:
This livestream yoga class took place on Monday, Aug 31st. Fiji introduces the class at around 6 minutes, the class begins at 12 minutes and ends at 1hr 12 minutes. She spends the final 8 minutes speaking with students on YouTube.

Description: In this 60-minute class, Fiji will lead you on an invigorating journey, exploring intuitive flow, standing balances, and inversions. Get ready to generate some heat and stir up some energy!

title: Meditate and Flow Livestream with David Procyshyn - Aug 28 @ 10am PST
body:
*We experienced a lot of audio problems with this class. We've posted the video above as-is and have attempted to fix the video but there were too many glitches.*

This livestream yoga class took place on Friday, Aug. 28th. David introduces the class at 50 seconds, the class begins at around 2 minutes and ends at 55 minutes. 

Description: In this 60-minute class, David will help you focus your mind, let go of tension and stress and move your body through a series of poses, fluidly and mindfully. This is a gentle beginner class that will help you release built-up stiffness in your muscles and is accessible to all levels.

title: Embodiment Meditation
body: This seated embodiment meditation with Ron invites participants to be present in their body. Following our breath, we turn inward and observe felt sensations and natural rhythms. We drop deeper into calming our nervous system, leaving the distractions of the busy world around us. Note: You may want to use a bolster or chair to sit on for this practice.

title: Time Out Yoga for Kids
body: This time out yoga practice with Alyssa Jean is perfect for those moments when we have BIG feelings, LOTS of energy and need to take a few minutes to be with ourselves so that we do not take this energy out on what’s around us and the ones we love. The class begins with some vigorous movements to match that big energy, some deep breathing, gentle inversions and restorative postures. Bringing the energy back down to a comfortable place, slowing down and coming back to the now.

title: Feeling Good Livestream Yoga Class with Melissa Krieger - Aug 15th @9am PST
body:
This livestream yoga class took place on Saturday, Aug 15th. Melissa introduces the class at 12 minutes, the class begins at around 13 minutes and ends at 1hr 12 minutes. She spends the final 7 minutes speaking with students on YouTube.

Description: In this 60-minute class, Melissa will help you get your whole body stretched out and feeling good!

title: Strength to Surrender: A Yin to Yang Flow
body: It takes courage to truly let our guard down, to release deeply held tension and patterns of meeting resistance. This practice with Fiji will flow through the ebb and flow of yin and yang energy. We will learn where and when to engage and how to fully release the body. To establish balance within, we need to bring balance to our practice.

title: Jivamukti-Inspired Steady Flow
body:
This intermediate jivamukti inspired class with Jonni-Lyn is a slow steady burn that moves you through sun salutations, standing poses, a few strength building poses, core work and some hip work. It ends with a headstand, pranayama and a long savasana. A class that moves you and opens you up!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Yoga Break for Busy Moms
body: This beginner hatha practice with Jonni-Lyn is a quick break to nourish your body and soul. It takes you through gentle body movements to create space, as well as release tension, ending with relaxation and a simple breathing exercise for balance and calmness. This practice is created for busy moms but it is also suitable for anyone who needs a little break and care.

title: Body to Light Meditation
body: In this beginner's guided meditation, Nyk walks you through a visualization of light filling your whole body, leaving you gently energized and refreshed from head to toe. If you would like to learn many ways and modifications to sit, check out Nyk's Meditation: How to Sit. Note: You will need two blankets and two yoga bricks for this practice.

title: Vinyasa Through the Vayus
body: Prana or energy, moves through us in different ways. This invigorating class with Fiji will lead you through an exploration of the vayus, or winds of energy movement. Each of the five vayus will be explained and incorporated into this vinyasa style practice.

title: Japa Meditation with Om Namah Shivaya
body: Join Jonni-Lyn in this Japa meditation using the mantra "Om Namah Shivaya". This mantra is chanted to Shiva, who is The Lord of Destruction. Without endings there cannot be beginnings, so we honor the endings and change as well as the beginnings. Namah Shivaya has many translations but a common one is "O salutations to the auspicious one!". Note: Mala beads are optional for this practice.

title: Power Flight
body: Power your way to eka pada galavasana, also known as arm balancing pigeon or flying pigeon pose, in this advanced intermediate power flow. This class with Rachel adds workshop style tips into a consistent flowing practice to help you on your path to mastering this complex arm balance. On the way, you’ll work on shoulder stability, core strength and hip opening.

title: Yoga for Knee Arthritis
body: This class with David is perfect for anyone who would like to help reduce the symptoms from arthritis in their knees, recover from knee replacement surgery or improve the flexibility and range of motion in the knees. It's a gentle, hatha yoga class that mixes self massage and effective stretching.

title: Supported Flying Splits
body: In this invigorating vinyasa flow practice, Andrea guides you to refine the elements you need to take flight in the flying splits, also known as eka pada koundinyasana II. Build strong foundations in the hands, wrist, and core, expand flexibility in your inner thighs, stabilize your shoulders and make use of props to access this powerful hand balance.

title: Revolve and Evolve
body: Turn in, literally, with this deep exploration on how to evolve an asana that revolves. Twists are potent and complex asanas that are a vital part of our physical and energetic practice. In this intermediate vinyasa practice, Fiji will breakdown and build up a variety of intricate standing twists.

title: Japa Mantra Meditation
body: Japa meditation is the repetition of a mantra. In this practice with Jonni-Lyn, we will use the mantra “Om Mani Padme Hum” which is a traditional Buddhist chant, which can translate to “The Jewel is in the Lotus” or “Praise to the Jewel in the Lotus”. Check out some of Jonni's other meditations, including this brief seated introduction to Japa Meditation.

title: Intro to Restorative Yoga
body: In this beginner introduction class, Nyk gently guides you through supported poses and long holds so that you can recharge your batteries and calm your nervous system. Note: This practice requires quite a few props. You will need 2 bolsters, 2 blocks, 2 blankets, 2 bricks, a strap and an eye pillow is optional.

title: Yoga for Abs
body: In need of a little core boost? This quick vinyasa flow class with Jonni-Lyn is designed to build core strength through a variety of different yoga poses and variations. It's a great, short practice to add after a class or can also be done as a stand-alone.

title: Meditation: How to Sit
body: Sometimes when we are trying to develop a regular meditation practice, the most difficult part is finding a comfortable way to sit. In this practice, Nyk shows you many ways to sit, including modifications for those who don't find sitting cross-legged on the floor possible. Note: You will need a few props for this class.

title: So Hum Meditation
body: In this 10 minute guided meditation with Jonni-Lyn, we explore the gyan mudra (hand gesture) and work with the traditional mantra "So Hum". This mantra translates into "I am That". No props are necessary for this practice, just an open heart and a few minutes of your day.

title: Dropping Into Stillness
body: Take a step back and relax your mind with this short but powerful meditation. In under 15 minutes, Nyk guides you from the busyness of the external world into the quiet centre of your being. This practice can also be an effective way to prepare for a goodnight's rest. Note: You may want to have a bolster or cushion to sit on.

title: Ganesha Meditation
body: In this practice, Jonni-Lyn guides you through an exploration of Ganesha, the elephant head god of hinduism. Traditionally understood to be the remover of obstacles, learn how Ganesha can help you in your everyday life. Through chanting, mudra and japa meditation, we start to discover more about obstacles and how to approach them. Note: You may want a bolster or pillow to sit on for this class.

title: Find Your Sweet Spot : Sugarcane Pose
body: Play with balance, open your quads and find your sweet spot in this challenging but accessible practice towards sugarcane pose, also known as ardha chandra chapasana. Inspired by lalita, the divine mother of the universe who wields a sugarcane bow and five rose tipped arrows, this vinyasa flow sequence teaches us to backbend with compassion and self-love.

title: Yin Yoga for the Neck and Shoulders
body: Tight shoulders and sore neck muscles are all too common. In this short and effective practice, Nyk helps you to find relief in these chronic tight spots and experience a new felt sense of spaciousness in the body.

title: Gentle Yoga for Pain Care
body: In this class, Tianne teaches you specific pain care techniques to help reduce pain, increase mobility and stimulate healing. The principles learnt may be applied to any class as well as movement off the mat and throughout our day. This wonderful practice is suitable for all levels and ends with a short body scan in shavasana.

title: Short and Sweet Vinyasa Flow
body: Looking for something short and sweet? If you only have 15 minutes, this quick vinyasa flow practice will move your body in all the different directions the spine moves, including standing poses, twists, inversions, backbends, and forward bends.

title: Rise and Thrive
body: Fiji brings you another short, invigorating morning practice to start your day with energy and intention. She takes you through a vinyasa yoga flow that will awaken your body and mind with challenging poses, creative transitions, breath work and twists. No props needed here!

title: Meditation: Loving-Kindness
body: In this guided meditation, Guy leads you through the use of loving-kindness or “metta” phrases to help you build a sense of inner peace and clear intention. This is a great way to either start or end your day, allowing your loving-kindness practice to sink deeply and infuse your feelings, thoughts and actions. Note: You may want a bolster, block, chair or cushion to sit on.

title: Yoga for Kids 5 to 12: Wake Up!
body: Help your kids wake up and start the day right with David's fun, playful and energetic morning yoga class for kids and families. He begins with a short guided meditation, then moves you through a sequence of creative poses, then finishes with a calming relaxation. Although this class is called 'Wake Up!', it can be done anytime of the day.

title: Quick Recharge
body: Need a quick recharge for your day? This 20 minute class is designed to give you a full practice and includes breathwork, two different sun salutations, hip openers, inversions and a final relaxation. When you're short on time but want to move and wake up all parts of your body, this practice is for you.

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Move and Strengthen
body: In this fun yoga class for kids and families, David gets you moving and strengthening your body in a more challenging flow for ages 6-12 and their parents and care-givers. Get ready to move and maybe even put on a sweat!

title: Release Back Tension
body: Tianne guides you through this gentle class full of restorative poses, helping to release tension in different areas of your back. Guided breath practices are also included to help support deeper relaxation. Note: Using an eye pillow in this practice is optional.

title: Yoga for Kids 2 to 5: Stretch like an Animal
body: In this yoga class for kids and families, Jonni-Lyn guides you through a sequence of postures using mantra chants, breathing exercises and animals. This creative class is the perfect blend of yoga and fun!

title: A Guide to Yoga for Absolute Beginners
body:
In this three minute video, Rachel demystifies yoga and shares what absolute beginners need to know to comfortably start a practice.

If you're looking for your beginner's guide to yoga, visit our Yoga for Beginners page on our website. If you're looking to become a teacher, check out our 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program.

title: Breaking Down Downward Facing Dog Pose
body:
Join Rachel in this tutorial as she breaks down and illuminates the key actions needed to set up and practice downward facing dog safely and effectively. 

To continue learning, check out our 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program, specifically Rachel's 5-hour course, Principles of Teaching.

title: How to Create Shoulder Stability in Your Practice
body:
Follow Rachel in this four minute tutorial and learn how to effectively recruit the muscles of your shoulder girdle to support your body weight when weight bearing on your hands.

To continue learning, check out our 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program, specifically Rachel's 5-hour course, Anatomy of the Shoulder.

title: Yoga for Kids 2 to 5: Safari Adventure
body: Are you ready to go on a Safari Adventure? Let's go! In this playful practice with Jonni-Lyn, we will fly on an airplane, set up our tent and meet all kinds of animals on our adventure. This class is perfect for ages 2 to 5 but the whole family is welcome to join in!

title: Happy Knees in Eagle Pose
body:
In this quick tutorial, Rachel shares some tips and tricks on how to perform the eagle pose safely for your knees.

To continue learning, check out our 250-Hour Yoga Teacher Training Program, specifically Rachel's 5-hour course, Anatomy of the Knee.

title: Yin Yoga for an Open Heart
body: In this practice, Nyk guides you through yin yoga poses that open your physical and metaphysical heart, improving not only your posture but also capacity for joy and compassion.

title: Yoga for Kids 2 to 5: Balloon Breath
body: In this exciting kids' yoga class with Jonni-Lyn, we get silly, blow up balloons with our bodies and fly around the room! Perfect for ages 2 to 5 and the kid in you. Note: Your child can bring their favorite stuffed animal as a breathing buddy.

title: Intermediate Yin: A Quiet Practice
body: In this full-length intermediate yin yoga class, Nyk guides you through a well-rounded practice with plenty of space between words so you can drop deeply into stillness & quietness.

title: Yoga for Kids 2 to 5: Jungle Walk
body: Are you ready for a jungle adventure? Join Jonni-Lyn as she takes a walk through the jungle! Who will we meet on our adventure together? For this yoga class for kids, you just need a stuffed animal for a breathing buddy, some space on the floor and your imagination. This class is suitable for ages 2 to 5 and a great activity for the whole family to join in!

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Stretch and Balance
body: This fun kids' yoga class for ages 6 to 12 includes guided meditation, stretching, moving through poses and balancing. David's energy and engaging approach encourages kids' imagination, while teaching them how to relax, let go of anxiety and feel positive.

title: Yoga for a Strong Back
body: In this therapeutic sequence, Nyk guides you through a variety of poses designed to help strengthen the key muscles in your back. Note: You may catch Nyk getting mixed up with the mirroring at times. What can we say? It happens to the best of us!

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Standing Poses
body: In this yoga class for kids and families, David gets everyone using their whole body, as he moves you through a fun and challenging series of yoga poses that helps you get stronger and flexible, while inspiring your imagination and calming your nervous system! Perfect for ages 6-12, it's a nice way for families to bond and have fun together!

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Move and Stretch
body: In this fun kids' yoga class for ages 6 to 12, David brings a creative approach to moving and stretching your body. Using imagery, animals, breathing and mindfulness exercises, David helps you and your children get your bodies moving, while learning how to focus, relax, feel your body and center your mind.

title: Yoga for Kids 5 to 10: Bedtime
body: Join David in this yoga class for kids and families that helps everyone get ready for a good night's sleep! Perfect for ages 5-10, it teaches everyone tools that they can use to calm their minds, relax their bodies and reduce anxiety.

title: Basics and Beyond : Full Body Integration
