body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 - Full Body Integration in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. In this class, you will integrate everything you've learned along with some familiar poses and a few fun ones!

title: Basics and Beyond : Forward Folds
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 6 - Forward Folds in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. Join Melissa as she takes you through a slower paced practice that focuses on forward folding in standing and seated poses. Note: You will need 2 blocks for this class.

title: Basics and Beyond : Twists
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 5 - Twists in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. This fun beginner class with Melissa is focused on different twisting poses including reclined, on all-fours, standing, lunging and seated. These twists help to release the entire spine while also getting into the hips and shoulders for a full body practice.

title: Basics and Beyond : Side Stretches
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 4 - Side Stretches in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. Perfect for all levels, this gentle practice focuses on side bends and stretching out the sides of your torso. Note: You will need a block for this class.

title: Basics and Beyond : Gentle Backbends
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 3 - Gentle Backbends in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. Let Melissa guide you through how to carefully and effectively perform gentle backbends on your back, stomach, all-fours and standing while engaging your deep core muscles to keep your back feeling strong and safe.

title: Basics and Beyond : Balance
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 2 - Balance in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. In this gentle but strong class, Melissa teaches you how to balance on your feet and on all-fours using your breath, core and leg strength.

title: Basics and Beyond : Breath and Basics
body: This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 1 - Breath and Basics in Melissa's weeklong series: Basics and Beyond 7-Day Yoga Challenge. This is a gentle, full body practice that teaches you basic yoga positions and how to connect your breath to your core. It also introduces you to the different shapes that you will work into throughout this challenge.

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: The Tree and the Very Bad Guys
body: This kids class focuses on imagination, telling a simple story through a sequence of postures. Each character in the story is represented through different poses. The central character is a tree standing on the side of a mountain. Along the way, the tree meets Mr. Very Bad #1 and Mr. Very Bad #2 (virabhadrasana 1 and 2), and happily continues from there through to a final rest in the forest.

title: Yoga for Kids 6 to 12: Be Your Own Teacher
body: In this class focusing on fun and creativity for kids from 6 to 12, Guy and his two young assistants share their 10-step pattern to designing your own yoga class. This is an impromptu class that encourages children to invent their own poses while following a basic general structure and flow. This is also a great class for kids and caregivers to do together. Have fun!

title: Yang to Yin
body: This is a more challenging class than Satiya's typical offering. It's grounded in a gentle, slow flow but features a few beginner to intermediate poses. She begins the moderately paced Yang to Yin practice with standing poses to get your body warmed up, then helps you work your way down to the floor where the postures become longer, the breath becomes deeper and you slowly begin to settle into stillness.

title: Deep Rest - A Guided Relaxation
body: This gentle practice is perfect for a good night's rest or times of high stress. Lay down, get comfy and let Nyk take you through a body scan and guided relaxation from your head to your toes. Note: Using a blindfold in this class is optional.

title: Courage and Backbends
body: Join Jonni-Lyn as she helps you to find courage in this jivamukti inspired backbending class that is designed to strengthen, open and expose you to a few backbends that are not in your everyday practice. The poses we explore include bhekasana or frog pose, baby wheel and urdhva dhanurasana. No props needed here!

title: Bedtime Lullaby
body: Get ready for rest with this sweet and nurturing gentle yoga class. Through breathwork, gentle stretching and mild flows, this class helps you to calm your nervous system and prepare your body for a good night’s sleep.

title: Hips, Legs and Lower Body Warm Up
body: Start your day right with this gentle hatha flow class for beginners. Satiya guides you through a simple warm up routine targeting the hips, legs and lower back. Not only is this a perfect way to wake up the mind and body, it is also a great warm up routine in preparation for a more challenging yoga class.

title: Meditation: Guided Embodiment
body: In this guided meditation, Guy leads you towards relaxing and releasing tensions and patterns of holding throughout your body. You’ll feel much calmer and centered by the end of this one! Note that you may want a bolster, block, chair or cushion to sit on.

title: Arm Balances for the Birds
body: Join Jonni-Lyn in this short and sweet challenging vinyasa class. You will work your way through various arm balances, while keeping your strong flow going and breathing smooth. No props required for this practice.

title: Neck, Shoulder And Upper Body Warm Up
body: Feeling a little tense? Try this practice. Satiya leads you through this short and sweet hatha flow class that aims to release tension in the body, warming up the upper body, neck and shoulders. Use this relaxation practice any time of the day.

title: Neutral Spine, Playful Balance
body: Ron helps you find and maintain a neutral spine as you play with twists, forward folds, side bends and balancing poses in this class delivered in trademark style!

title: Refine and Align: Compass Pose
body: In this intermediate flow, Andrea guides you to merge the elements you need to find your true north. This challenging seated posture requires open hips and inner thighs, plus both stability and mobility in the shoulders. Note: For this class, it is recommended to have 2 blocks and lots of courage!

title: Refine and Align: Wild Thing
body: Get ready to power up your hands and wrists and cultivate techniques to transition with functional intelligence towards this fierce heart-opener, also known as camatkarasana or flip dog. In this intermediate vinyasa flow class, Andrea helps you focus on transitions that open your chest, hips, shoulder area and much more.

title: Inversions Playtime
body: In this 25 minute vinyasa flow class, Jonni-Lyn guides you through a few different headstand (sirsasana) variations, including finding full lotus while upside down. There's a fun transition from headstand II, to chutaranga included. Watch for it and remember to flex your feet if you are going to give it a try. To cool down the nervous system, the class ends with shoulder stand and variations.

title: Slow Flow: Salutation Variations
body: In this short class, Guy guides you through a series of three distinct salutation sequences: salute to all directions, salute to the gods and goddesses, and salute to the moon. Use any or all of these sequences at the start of your practice — particularly in the morning — to get your body warmed up and your energy flowing.

title: Slow Flow: From Yang to Yin
body: Guy invites you to move from active to relaxed, from warm to cool and from busy to calm in his Yang-into-Yin slow flow practice. It begins with a series of warming movements, flows into several shorter standing poses and then drops down to the floor for a juicy sequence of longer held Yin poses. This is a great practice to help dissipate the busyness of your day and drop into relaxation.

title: Slow Flow: Forgiveness Sequence
body: Feeling the need to clear mental or emotional blockages? Join Guy as he guides you through nine rounds of a salutation called the forgiveness sequence. Let go of repetitive thoughts or feelings and simply sink into the rhythm and flow of breath and movement in this short hatha flow practice that requires no props.

title: Slow Flow: Seated Practice
body: Guy takes you through a seated practice that is perfect for before bed or anytime you're looking for a gentle and warming stretch. Check out some of Guy's other slow flow classes like Slow Flow: Focus on Knees, or Slow Flow: Focus on Transitions. Oh, and please don't take Guy's photochromatic lenses personally. He's only hiding from the sun, not you!

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Balancing
body: In this slow flow class, Guy shows you how to apply the basics of balancing, from weight shifting and distribution, through to single-leg balances. Learn to find groundedness and stability in both static and dynamic states. Check out other slow flow classes from Guy like Slow Flow: Focus on Hips or Slow Flow: Full Spectrum.

title: Slow Flow: Full Spectrum
body: In this slow flow practice, Guy draws on the various techniques introduced in his other slow flow classes to offer a slightly more challenging full-spectrum, full-body practice. It includes a variety of elements including shoulders, hips, knees, balancing, sitting, transitions, breath awareness and body awareness.

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Hips
body: In this fun hatha flow yoga class, Guy guides you through a series of standing, balancing, seated and reclined poses, before concluding with a blissful relaxation. Learn to build strength and stability in the hips while releasing and relieving any tension across the hip joints. Note: It is recommended that you use a block and a blanket for elevating your hips while sitting, but these props are optional.

title: Slow Flow: Inner Awareness
body: In this super-slow flow practice, Guy focuses on bringing your attention to your inner sensations and experiences – a process known as “interoception”. You will flow through a beginner sequence of standing and reclining poses, following your own inner intelligence as your main guide in each pose. Note: It is recommended that you use a block and a blanket for kneeling poses, but these props are optional.

title: Refine and Align: Hanuman
body: This fun intermediate flow class invites you to align your hips, ignite your core and open your hamstrings to take hanuman's great leap. Using blocks, Andrea guides you to stabilize and strengthen this powerful asana.

title: Offer it Up
body: Explore your balance, hip openers, and twists in this fun, uptempo flow with Tracey. A delicious whole-body experience!

title: Exploring the Edge
body: Push your limits in this class focused on expanding into some challenging peak poses. As Fiji says, it's all about those millimeter miracles!

title: Lift Up
body:
In this class, Tracey helps you find your way into some variations of bakasana, crow pose. Learn how to use your core to find lightness and lift, and enjoy some deep shoulder and hip openers to keep your body fluid and mobile.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 11 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Highway to Hanuman
body: In this jivamukti inspired practice, Jonni-Lyn guides you through our exploration of hanumanasana, or monkey pose. Learn to connect with the devotion and bravery that this pose's namesake, hanuman, was famous for. For this class, it is recommended to have 2 blocks, a blanket and a strap, however this is entirely optional.

title: Pigeon Play
body:
Find new space in your outer hips and IT bands in this intermediate/advanced vinyasa flow with Fiji. Wonderful for runners and other athletes, this class will have your hips singing with joy!

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 26 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge

title: Refine and Align: Side Plank
body:
In this targeted vinyasa flow sequence, Andrea guides you to power up your shoulder girdle, wrists, hands and core to build a more functional and sustainable side plank (vasithasana).

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 7 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Revolution: From the Inside Out
body: Learn to twist from the inside out in this playful vinyasa flow with Andrea. Access your core strength and draw energy inwards to help create new lightness and lift in twisting poses.

title: Flip Your Lizard
body: Get ready for something new in this playful advanced class with Jonni-Lyn. Learn how to flip your lizard pose onto its back and work your way safely into a chin balance. There's no time like the present for learning new things!

title: Arrive and Thrive
body:
Learn the joy of grounding yourself in the here and now in this intermediate/advanced vinyasa class. Tracey helps you stay present, as you strengthen and stretch your shoulders and hips, engage through the mid line, and progress toward the peak pose, flying pigeon.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 29 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Balancing Postures : Exploring Masculine and Feminine
body: Learn how to cultivate awareness of masculine and feminine energies in this class focused on single leg balancing poses. In this intermediate/advanced flow, Ron shows you how to find equilibrium between opposing forces and hug to your midline to find strength, stability and groundedness.

title: Wring it In, Wring it Out
body:
Wring out the old and wring in the new in this class that is all about twists! Fiji will help you work up a sweat in this intermediate/advanced vinyasa flow that also incorporates a few fun arm balances.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 30 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Choose Joy
body: Focus in on the connection between the head and the heart in this joyful practice with Tracey Noseworthy.  Learn to follow your heart with confidence and serenity as you work though side body, shoulder and hip stretches, along with chest openers and balances.

title: Movement in Stillness, Stillness in Movement
body: Learn how to find both stillness and activation in this wonderful intermediate/advanced flow from Tracey. Stir up the second chakra and ignite your creativity through circular movement, repetition and depth!

title: Poise and Perseverance: Developing Your 20/20 Vision
body: Bring your awareness inward in this fun flow with Ron Stewart. We often think of vision as something we direct outwards, but in this class Ron flips that idea on its head and helps you direct your attention deep within. Note: Using a blindfold in this class is optional.

title: PNF Stretch: Biceps and Triceps
body: This stretch is often called a ‘posterior hand clasp’ or, in yoga, it’s the upper part of cow face pose (gomukhasana). This pose stretches both of your arms - the triceps and serratus anterior in the upper arm and the biceps and rotator cuff in the lower arm.

title: PNF Stretch: Wrist Flexors
body: In this video, David shows you how you can use the PNF technique to increase the flexibility in your wrists, namely the inside of the wrists or the wrist flexors. This is a great stretch to do if are a musician, you work with your hands or are on a computer a lot.

title: PNF Stretch: Biceps II
body: This video shows you how to stretch your bicep muscles using PNF. This stretch also helps release your rotator cuff muscles - your supraspinatus, infraspinatus and teres minor.

title: PNF Stretch: Trapezius
body: This stretch release not only the trapezius muscle, but key rotator cuff muscles as well, including the supraspinatus, infraspinatus and teres minor.

title: PNF Stretch: Latissimus Dorsi II
body: In this video, David shows you how to stretch your latissimus dorsi using the PNF technique. In this stretch, you may also stretch the bicep of your lower arm, making this doubly effective!

title: PNF Stretch: Pectoralis II
body: In this short video, David shows you how to stretch the pectoralis major using the PNF technique and the floor. Lying down allows you to effectively use your body weight, which makes it easier to relax and release the stretching muscles.

title: PNF Stretch: Rotator Cuff
body: The rotator cuff can be a difficult group of muscles to stretch. In this video, David shows you how to stretch key rotator cuff muscles - the supraspinatus, infraspinatus and teres minor, along with the biceps - while lying on the floor. It allows you to use your body weight to effectively release these muscles using the PNF

title: PNF Stretch: Deltoid
body: This video shows you how to use PNF to stretch the deltoid muscles, more specifically the middle and posterior fibers of the deltoid.

title: PNF Stretch: Triceps
body: In this quick video, David teaches you how to stretch your triceps using the PNF technique.

title: PNF Stretch: Biceps I
body: The biceps can be chronically tight if we sit slouched at a desk or hunch forward in any way. They can also easily be overused, stiff and sore. In this short video, David teaches you how to use the PNF technique to release the biceps in both arms at the same time.

title: PNF Stretch: Latissimus Dorsi I
body: The latissimus dorsi the one that pulls your arm back, like you would do during a swimming stroke. Releasing this powerful muscle can help you find relief from shoulder, neck and chest pain, as well as increase the range of motion in your shoulder joints. This stretch also helps release your teres major, pectoralis major and serratus.

title: PNF Stretch: Pectoralis I
body: The pectoralis is a key muscle in so many activities, such as push-ups or chaturanga. It’s also a muscle that can get very tight if we allow the shoulders to drop forward as we stand, move and sit at a desk. This stretch helps release the pectoralis, helping your chest open and your upper back to lift.

title: PNF: Double Quadriceps Stretch
body: Tight hip flexors - the quadricep muscles in particular - can limit the movement of your pelvis, preventing it from tilting back. Because the backward tilt of the pelvis is important in a backbend, this is a great stretch if you are looking to deepen your backbends or help you move into one more safely.

title: PNF Stretch: Calf
body: Tight calves can lead to a variety of problems, including plantar fasciitis, knee pain and lower back pain. This quick video shows you how to use PNF to release the tension in your calf muscles, increasing the flexibility in the back of your legs.

title: PNF Stretch: Twist
body: Tight muscles around the spine can limit movement in so many ways, including twists. In this short video, David shows you how to use PNF to increase the flexibility of your spine in a twist.

title: PNF: Double Hamstrings Stretch
body: Even though this is a simple seated forward fold, it can be quite an intense stretch for those who have tight hamstrings and/or lower back. Move into it carefully if you have any history of lower back problems, and breathe.

title: PNF Stretch: Quadriceps II
body: This stretch can be quite intense with adding the PNF technique, so move into it carefully and make sure you are breathing as you hold it. The quadricep muscle is an important hip flexor, so it can be tight for those of you who sit or run a lot.

title: PNF Stretch: Groin II
body: Many of you will recognize this stretch as butterfly pose (baddha konasana). This take on that popular pose adds the effectiveness of PNF to help release the groin muscles more deeply.

title: PNF Stretch: IT Band and TFL
body: A good IT band and TFL stretch can be the difference between running with and without pain and discomfort. This stretch helps runners and athletes recover from chronic IT band tightness, releasing two muscles that play such an important role in running.

title: PNF Stretch: Lower Back
body: This stretch is exactly the same as a pose called happy baby, or dead bug pose (ananda balasana). In this video, David shows you how to incorporate PNF to increase the flexibility in your lower back and hips.

title: PNF Stretch: Piriformis
body: A tight piriformis muscle can lead to tension and pain in the legs, hips and lower back, so releasing this key muscle can provide immense relief, as well as a wonderful feeling of improved range of motion. The piriformis is a muscle that externally rotates the leg. Along with it, you will be stretching the remaining external hip rotators, low back rotators and gluteus maximus.

title: PNF Stretch: Hamstrings II
body: This video teaches you how to use the PNF technique to release the hamstrings while seated. Tight hamstrings can lead to leg, back and neck pain, so releasing them regularly can prevent this.

title: PNF Stretch: Hip Flexor (Psoas)
body: In this short video, David shows you how you can use the PNF technique to release the psoas and iliopsoas, which are key hip flexor muscles. Because it lifts the leg forward, the psoas can be very tight in those who sit a lot, run or cycle.

title: PNF Stretch: Lower Back Side Bend
body: This video teaches you how to release tension in your lower back using the PNF technique. David will be showing you how to do a seated side bend in a way that stretches the erector spinae and quadratus lumborum, two key muscles that connect your spine to your pelvis.

title: PNF Stretch: Groin
body: In this short video, David teaches you how you can use the PNF technique to increase the flexibility of your groin muscles, which will help you increase the range of motion of your hip joints and ease tension in your legs and lower back.

title: PNF Stretch: Quadriceps at the Wall
body: This video shows you how to use the PNF technique, and the wall, to safely and effectively stretch the quadriceps. The wall allows you to move into the stretch slowly and carefully, while increasing flexibility in this powerful muscle.

title: PNF Stretch: Hip External Rotators
body: This video shows you how to use the PNF method to stretch the six external rotators of the hip, which include the quadratus femoris and piriformis muscles. It also stretches the gluteus maximus.

title: PNF Stretch: Hip Internal Rotators
body: In this short video, David teaches you how to release tightness in your gluteus medius, gluteus minimus and tensor fascia latae (TFL) using the PNF technique. It’s a great stretch for improving range of motion, improving athletic performance, reducing injury and relieving  lower back pain.

title: PNF Stretch: Hamstrings I
body: David shows you how to easily and effectively stretch your hamstrings using the PNF technique, encouraging the release of tightness and tension and increasing flexibility in the hamstrings. This stretch is great for a variety of people, including athletes, runners, office workers and those trying to ease lower back pain.

title: PNF Stretch: Gluteus Maximus
body: In this short video, David teaches you how to stretch your gluteus maximus muscle using proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (PNF). This is a great stretch for so many people, including athletes, desk workers and those suffering from lower back pain.

title: The Elements #14
body: In this class, Crista helps you connect to all five elements: earth, water, fire, air and ether. Leading you in a chanting elemental seed sounds while guiding you through an innovative flow, Crista helps you connect the elements directly to your physical practice. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #13
body: In this class, Crista guides you in bringing all five elements -- earth, water, fire, ether, and air --  into alignment, helping you really get a feel for what they mean and how they can be expressed through yoga. Incorporating titibasana, firefly pose, handstand hops and crow pose, this fun class can be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge, The Elements.

title: The Elements #12
body: In this challenging intermediate class, Crista shows you how to use prithvi mudra, the earth mudra, and bhu mudra, the mother earth mudra, to find stability and groundedness in poses like side crow and dragonfly. Honor the earth's ability to nourish and support us in a class that can be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #11
body: In this class, Crista shows you how to incorporate varun mudra (the water mudra) into an advanced flow that is all about moving seamlessly through fluid transitions, teaching you how to move with grace and integrity both on and off your mat. This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #10
body: In this fire class, Crista introduces you to apan mudra, the purification mudra, and to nauli kriya, a powerful cleansing exercise. Ignite your inner fire and cleanse your body in this practice that can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #9
body: Crista guides you through an invigorating vinyasa flow in this class dedicated to the air element. Learn to incorporate vayu mudra to help you connect to and regulate the air element within you, so that you can find the lightness and lift that will aid you throughout your practice. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #8
body: In this challenging intermediate class, Crista introduces you to akash mudra, the ether mudra, and shows you how to use it to find ease and lightness even in challenging poses like head and shoulder stand. Cultivate a sense of uplifting space within and without in this class that can be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #7
body: Crista leads you through a quick class that will help free up space in your hips, legs and chest. Incorporating postures like reverse tabletop with figure-4 legs, this is a fun and beneficial class that can fit into even the busiest schedules. This class can be done as a stand alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge, The Elements. Please note that this class was formally named Short and Sweet.

title: The Elements #6
body: Crista introduces you to the ether mudra, dhyana mudra, in this intermediate class dedicated to contemplation, introspection, and inner clarity. This can be done as a stand-alone practice or as part of Crista's 14 day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #5
body: Crista introduces you to the mudra dedicated to the king of the birds, Garuda. This air-themed class that is all about heightening your intuition, learning to trust your inner voice, and allowing yourself to spread your beautiful wings. Perfect for intermediate students looking for a challenge, this class incorporates poses like bound elbow headstand, and wide-legged forearm stand. This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #4
body: In this challenging intermediate class, Crista introduces you to two complimentary mudras: kali mudra to help you develop a healthy ego and sense of self, and chin mudra to help you connect ego to a higher consciousness. This fire-themed class can either be done as a stand-alone class or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #3
body: In this water-themed class, Crista helps you find compassion for yourself and others by drawing on the inspiration of lotus mudra. Incorporating challenging poses like handstand and cross-ankle crow, this class is perfect for those working at an advanced level. It be done as a stand-alone class or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge: The Elements.

title: The Elements #2
body: Crista guides you through a grounding flow class that emphasizes a connection to the earth and makes use of Ganesha mudra, a mudra dedicated to the Hindu god Ganesh, the remover of obstacles. This class can be done as a stand-alone or as part of Crista's 14-day challenge, The Elements.

title: The Elements #1
body: In this class, Crista introduces you to the elements -- earth, water, fire, air and ether -- and helps you explores how to incorporate them into your yoga practice through an innovative flow. This class can be done as a stand alone or as part of Crista's 14-Day Challenge, the Elements, in which you learn how to integrate the elements into your practice through asana, breathwork, mantra, and hand mudras. This class is also Day 20 in the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 7
body: In this class, Rachel guides you through a fluid flow that integrates many of the fundamentals of yoga -- breathwork, core engagement, grounding, shoulder stability, alignment -- and leads you seamlessly towards the peak pose: dancer. This practice can be done as a stand-alone or as the conclusion to Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 6
body: This practice helps you prepare your body for safe and opening backbends. Rachel reviews the key actions you need to protect your lumbar spine and safely free the front body. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's Fundamentals of Practice 7-Day Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 5
body: Shoulder stability and mobility is essential in preparing you for inversions. In this faster-paced practice, Rachel reinforces the essential actions you need to develop functional strength and stability in preparation for more advanced poses. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 4
body: Integrate deep core awareness into your practice and prepare your body for safe hand-balancing in this beginner/intermediate class. Rachel guides you in revisiting your foundation to safely protect your wrists when weight-bearing in balancing poses like side plank and crow. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 3
body: This class teaches you the key actions you need to effectively practice twisting poses such as revolved chair, revolved lunge and revolved triangle pose. Practicing twists effectively is the key to preparing for more advanced poses like backbends! This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 2
body: In this practice, Rachel helps you find new space and stability through the hips. Learn and apply the essential actions you need to work your hips into externally rotated poses like warrior 2 and side angle pose, and half moon. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Fundamentals of Practice Day 1
body: In this class, Rachel guides you in setting up your foundation, teaching you how to place and activate your feet and hands to stabilize and support your yoga practice. This class can either be done as a stand-alone or as part of Rachel's 7-Day Fundamentals of Practice Yoga Challenge.

title: Cool and Calm Yoga
body: Take some time for yourself in this gentle flow sequence, designed by Melissa Krieger to calm and cool your body and mind. In just thirty minutes you will feel more re-engaged in your day, with a happier, lighter state of being!

title: Happy Wrists Yoga Class
body: This is a wrist-free yoga practice. Melissa guides you through the perfect yoga class for those unable to do wrist-intensive poses like cat, cow, plank or downward dog...or for anyone looking for something a little different! Enjoy this gentle flow that incorporates half sun salutations, yogic squats, seated twists, and reclined hip-openers! Note that it is suggested you have a bolster for this class or something else you can comfortably sit on.

title: Pilates: Creative Challenge
body: Work your legs, arms, obliques and open your hips in this class that puts a creative twist on your typical Pilates repertoire. Kathi will have your core singing by the end of this delightful intermediate class!

title: Pilates: Focus on Balance
body: Kathi helps you strengthen your stabilizers in this intermediate Pilates class that is all about finding balance. Designed to work your whole body in just over 26 minutes, this is a satisfying practice that can fit into even the busiest days!

title: Advanced Pilates Flow
body: Kathi gets your blood pumping and your muscles singing in this innovative 25-minute advanced Pilates flow that can fit into a any busy schedule.

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Shoulders
body: In this slow flow practice, Guy helps you focus in on the movements of your shoulders, emphasizing joint safety and stability while improving shoulder strength and mobility. For more slow flow classes with Guy, check out Slow Flow: Focus on Knees or Slow Flow: Focus on Transitions.

title: Release Resistance Meditation
body: In this 10-minute guided meditation, Fiji leads you through seated mudra work and a guided body scan, allowing for full presence and acceptance. Find and release resistance on every level in this short but powerful class! Note: You may want to have a bolster or cushion to sit on.

title: Open Hips, Neutral Spine
body: In this playful beginners class, Ron helps you discover and maintain your spine’s neutral position while exploring some basic postures including table, downward-facing dog, and a reclining hip-opening sequence.

title: Prana 4: Nadi Shodhana Pranayama
body: Let Rachel guide you in one of her favorite pranayama practices, in this final installment of her four-part pranayama series. Nadi shodhana pranayama is designed to stimulate the feminine and masculine energetic channels of the body, resulting in a sense of deep calm and balance. Remember: pranayama should always create calm rather than anxiety, so if you feel short of breath or anxious, then leave the guided practice and return to an easeful, natural breath. The previous class in this series is Prana 3: Counted Breath with Full Retention.

title: Prana 3: Counted Breath and Full Retention
body: In this third class of her four-part pranayama series, Rachel guides you towards a “box” breath, in which you inhale, hold, exhale, and hold in equal parts. Breath retention can be a profound technique for calming the nervous system and stilling the body, but remember: if you feel short of breath or anxious, then leave the counted practice and return to an easeful, natural breath. You may want a chair, bolster or pillow to sit on for this practice. The previous class in this series is Prana 2: Counted Breath and Partial Retention. The final class in this series is Prana 4: Nadi Shodhana Pranayama.

title: Prana 2: Counted Breath and Partial Retention
body: In the second class of her four-part pranayama series, Rachel builds upon what you learned in Prana 1: Simple Counted Breath, by adding in a brief retention after the inhale. Remember: pranayama should never create anxiety. If you feel short of breath or anxious, then leave the counted practice and return to an easeful, natural breath. You may want to have a chair, pillow, or bolster to sit on for this practice. The previous class in this series is Prana 1: Simple Counted Breath. The next class in this series is Prana 3: Counted Breath and Full Retention.

title: Prana 1: Simple Counted Breath
body: In this first class of our her four-part pranayama series, Rachel introduces you to the simple counted breath. Simple counted breath is a profound technique that helps you quell anxiety and cultivate calm. Remember: pranayama should never create anxiety. If you feel short of breath or anxious, then leave the counted practice and return to an easeful, natural breath. You may want to have something to sit on like a block, chair, or bolster. After completing this class, you may want to check out the next class in Rachel's pranayama series Prana 2: Counted Breath and Partial Retention.

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Knees
body: Guy helps you bring intentionality and purpose to your movements in this slow flow class with a focus on knees. Learn to tune into subtle sensations and make small adjustments that will keep your knees safe and stable in bent or straight legged poses. Note: you may want a folded blanket or other soft support for the kneeling poses. Check out some of Guy's other slow flow classes like Slow Flow: Seated Practice, or Slow Flow: Focus on Transitions. Oh, and please don't take Guy's photochromic lenses personally. He's only hiding from the sun, not you!

title: The Desk Antidote: A Quick Standing Routine for Workers
body: Rachel guides you through a quick class designed to give your body some mid-day relief from your office work. All you need is a place to stand and a little space to stretch out.

title: Breathe Better: The Side Body Class
body: While yoga can promote full-body opening and strengthening, one area that tends to get neglected is the side body! In this class, Rachel helps you open and strengthen your lateral body. Opening your side body can promote better rib mobility, increased breath support, and lower back relief.

title: Plus Size Yoga: Modified Sun Salutations
body: In this class, Helen guides you through an exploration of Sun Salutation C with specific modifications for bigger bodies. Learn how to create space and move through transitions with control. If downward dog is not in your practice, you can work through this class from hands and knees.

title: Eye of the Lotus Meditation
body: In this class, Jonni-Lyn guides you through a Japa-style seated meditation based on mantra repetition. This class is accessible to both beginners and seasoned meditation practitioners. You may want a bolster or pillow to sit on. Mala beads are optional.

title: Internal Meditation
body: Reconnect with your own internal reality in this short but sweet guided mediation. In just 15 minutes, Ron helps you fall into stillness, observe your breath, notice your bodily sensations, and find inner calm. You can do this meditation from any seated position, so feel free to find yourself a bolster, chair or anything else that will help you find comfort and ease.

title: Plus Size Yoga: Heart Opening Practice
body: Helen encourages you to explore a variety of back bends in this class specially designed for bigger bodies. Find space along the front side of your body and open your heart while moving at a pace that works for you! To find out how to make a bolster at home, go here.

title: Yin/Yang Flow
body: This juicy class combines a delicious breath-centred flow series with targeted, yin-style hip openers to release tension and let go of the day’s stress. Rachel's calm and precise guidance will help you recover a sense of ease, making it the perfect class for the end of a long day.

title: Preparation for Forearm Balance
body: This challenging beginner class will teach you how to strengthen and prepare your body for forearm balance (pincha mayurasana). Perfect for beginners progressing towards a more intermediate practice, this class will also help open your shoulders, chest, and hamstrings. Note: Although blocks are not needed for this class, some practitioners may want to have a couple on hand to help support a few of the balancing postures.

title: Jivamukti: Fast and Fierce
body: Jonni-Lyn takes you through a Jivamukti Yoga-inspired flow that gets your whole body working! With quick transitions and very little rest, this invigorating class really lives up to its name!

title: Jivamukti-Inspired Jam
body: In this intermediate practice inspired by the Jivamukti yoga style, Jonni-Lyn guides you through a flow that engages your whole body, mind, and spirit. Note that while no equipment is strictly required, some practitioners may want a set of blocks to aid in some of the standing poses. Others may like a blanket on hand for savasana.

title: Head to Toe Yin Yoga
body: In this class full-length yin class, Nyk helps you find space and ease throughout your entire body. Offering assiduous physical and mental cues along with options to suit a variety of bodies and skill levels, Nyk ensures this class is accessible and vital for yogis of all levels.

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Transitions
body: In this class, Guy helps you explore the transitions between several common poses found in flow-style classes: child's pose, table top, plank, and downward dog. This class was designed with seniors in mind but, with a focus on economy of movement and proper alignment, it is the kind of practice that can benefit practitioners of all ages and levels. Check out some of Guy's other slow flow classes like Slow Flow: Seated Practice, or Slow Flow: Focus on Knees. Oh, and please don't take Guy's photochromic lenses personally. He's only hiding from the sun, not you!

title: Yoga for Cultivating Pleasure
body: This intermediate flow class is all about exploring pleasurable sensations in your body. Ron helps you flow through postures while staying connected to your breath and savouring your bodily sensations. His goal is to help you understand what is pleasurable on your mat, so that you are better able to find and cultivate pleasure in other areas of your life.

title: Elevate Day 14
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 14 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. This well-rounded vinyasa flow has a little bit of everything. For those completing the challenge, this class is a wonderful opportunity to observe the effects of all your hard work!

title: Elevate Day 13
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 13 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. In this challenging intermediate flow, Fiji helps you remain grounded and present through some difficult standing sequences. It's an excellent challenge for intermediate students hoping to push their limits.

title: Elevate Day 12
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 12 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. This class is all about finding space in your hips. Starting off with a vinyasa flow to warm you up, Fiji transitions into some nice deep hip openers. Note: a block is optional for this class.

title: Elevate Day 11
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 11 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. In this class, Fiji encourages you to bring your full awareness to a variety of dynamic poses while emphasizing length, stability and alignment. She finishes with a lovely series of passive twists.

title: Elevate Day 10
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 10 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. In this class, you'll move through a gentle warming flow before luxuriating in a series of longer shoulder openers.

title: Elevate Day 9
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 9 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. In this class, Fiji guides you through a series of arm balances including flying pigeon, firefly, and crane, helping you learn how to move into each pose with lightness and ease through step-by-step progressions.

title: Elevate Day 8
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 8 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. Fiji helps you free up some energy in this well-rounded vinyasa flow, incorporating a satifying series of invigorating twists.

title: Elevate Day 7
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 7 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. Fiji encourages you to take a break with this slow and rejuvinating class that begins with a slow vinyasa flow to warm your body up before moving into some deep restorative postures.

title: Elevate Day 6
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 6 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. Fiji sets out to challenge your balance in this class, paying particular attention to setting up good foundations as she takes you through a multi-level approach to a variety of arm balance poses. Note that it will help if you have a clear piece of wall to practice against.

title: Elevate Day 5
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 5 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. Being able to listen to your body and respond appropriately is an important yogic skill. In this class, Fiji helps you learn how to hone in on key sensations so you can make critical adjustments within each pose.

title: Elevate Day 4
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 4 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. In this vinyasa flow, Fiji helps you learn to connect and move with your breath. Conscious breathing is one of yoga's most challenging and important skills. It focuses your mind, grounds your body and gives your practice rhythm and pace.

title: Elevate Day 3
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 3 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. In this class, Fiji shows you how to gradually make your way towards key yoga poses like wheel pose (urdhva dhanurasana) and halfmoon pose (ardha chandrasana). By teaching you how to work into these poses through three levels of progression, Fiji ensures that you will grow into them safely and effectively.

title: Elevate Day 2
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 2 in Fiji's 14-Day Yoga Challenge, Elevate. In this vinyasa flow class, Fiji helps you incorporate the concept of levity into your practice. You will help you learn to move with lightness and ease by facing new challenges with a sense of humor. Note: a block is not required for this class, but some students may wish to have one to support them during some of the balancing postures.

title: Elevate Day 1
body: This class can be done as a stand-alone class or as day 1 in Fiji's 14-day yoga challenge, Elevate. In this class, Fiji guides you through a thorough, well-rounded vinyasa flow, paying particular attention to alignment and setting clear intentions. A great class for anyone looking to remind themselves about important yoga principles, and the perfect class to begin 14-days of dedicated practice!

title: Jivamukti Yoga Spiritual Warrior
body: This spirited and dynamic Jivamukti yoga class offers a well-rounded practice for your busy life. It incorporates a setting of intention, warm up, standing poses, basic twists, seated poses, deep backbends, inversions, and seated meditation. Modifications are offered to accommodate a range of intermediate to advanced skill levels.

title: Trust Yourself
body: Nicky leads you through a class designed to help you ground yourself in your body, let go of what doesn't serve you and learn to trust and connect with yourself. Incorporating guided meditation, focused breathing and seated and lying postures, this class is all about taking time for yourself. You don't strictly need any props for this class, but you may find that you want a block, bolster, or blanket to boost your hips.

title: Plus Size Yoga: A Wrist-Free Practice
body: If you have sensitive wrists, this is the class for you! The bulk of this practice is on the feet, exploring a series of flowing movements and classic asanas like Warrior 2 and Triangle. Helen makes sure to guide you through the entire class without putting any weight on your hands.

title: Handstands at the Wall
body: Incorporating hip openers, leg and core work, and of course handstands, this challenging intermediate class will have your muscles singing! Crista keeps you going with her trademark cheerfulness and rewards your effort with a long savasana. Note: You will need access to a nice clear section of wall in order to do the handstand portion of this class.

title: The Light Within
body: This challenging intermediate class invites you to tap into your own internal source of energy and inspiration. Beginning with an acknowledgement of the light and energy you hold within, Fiji guides your through a flow incorporating chest and hip openers, balances, and a variety of asanas that will test your strength and endurance.

title: Three Postures for Healing Grief
body: In this gentle yoga therapy class, Nicky takes you through three postures - melting heart pose, child's pose, and reclined goddess pose - that will help you process and manage grief. Offering plenty of variations, Nicky makes sure this practice is accessible to all skill levels.

title: Japa Meditation
body: Jonni-Lyn leads you in a brief seated introduction to Japa meditation, an ancient technique that uses mantra and mala to focus, calm and quiet the mind.

title: Baby and Me Post-Caesarean Yoga
body: In this postnatal parent and baby class, Sarah-Jane teaches you a sequence that will help your body recover from a caesarean - or even a natural birth - by safely targeting your core and pelvic floor and stretching your ribs, torso, low back, neck and shoulders, all while finding ways to bring baby into the mix.

title: Baby and Me Yoga for Energy and Joy
body: In this class for new mothers, Sarah guides you through a series of poses, with or without baby, to strengthen your pelvic floor, arms, shoulders and back. Take 20 minutes to rejuvenate your body as it undergoes its postpartum shifts.

title: Modified Prenatal Vinyasa
body: Sarah Jane guides you through a vinyasa adapted for mothers to be in their second and third trimesters. You will be doing modified side planks and outer and inner hip strengthening to make your body strong in the rest of your pregnancy and post partum, along with calf stretches, and spinal mobility to bring balance to the sacrum and facilitate good fetal positioning. Always stop at junctures where you feel dizzy and out of breath, and remember to stay hydrated. Build up to completing the full practice.

title: 7-Minute Office Yoga for the Head and Neck
body: This short, efficient class fits nicely into a busy work day and David takes time to release one of the most common areas of tension for those sitting at a desk, the neck. He begins the class with meditation and breathing to calm the nervous system and finishes with another short meditation.

title: 11-Minute Office Yoga for the Shoulders and Legs
body: You will be surprised how much you can do in 11 minutes! David begins this hatha yoga class with some deep breathing to calm the nerves, then moves you through an effective and thorough sequence of stretches for the shoulders, back and legs, finishing with a short meditation to transition you back into your workday.

title: 6-Minute Office Yoga for the Spine
body: In this quick and effective class, David takes you through all of the movements of the spine, focusing on those that will benefit office workers most. You will be surprised by how good you can feel after just 6 minutes!

title: Jivamukti Magic Ten
body: Jonni-Lyn leads you through 10 poses designed to move your spine in all the ways that it can. These poses will help keep you and your spine supple and flexible as well as build your strength. This class will both challenge and invigorate you in just 10 minutes!

title: 7-Minute Office Yoga for the Hips
body: This quick class focuses in on the hips, while also releasing the legs and spine. You will need some room on the floor for this class, since David will be moving you through a lunge, pigeon pose and seated cross-legged to finish.

title: 9-Minute Office Yoga for the Legs
body: Be prepared, because David moves right into this hatha yoga flow! While using the chair to help with a variety of standing poses, he helps you stretch the legs, hips and back in ways that will make you feel good, improve your posture and clear your head. He finishes with a short guided meditation.

title: Labor and Birth: Checking in with Your Body
body: Sarah-Jane guides you through some simple postures to practice in the third trimester. These postures will stretch the psoas and other contributory muscles of pregnancy and labor, and can be used up to, and including the day that you give birth.

title: A Full, Gentle Daily Practice
body: This calm, all levels hatha yoga class is gentle, but also has a few sequences that will be challenging for beginners. Satiya guides you through a flow that emphasizes listening in to what your body is telling you. With a good variety of poses to build strength, flexibility and balance, this gentle class can provide an array of benefits for yogis practicing at any level.

title: 6-Minute Office Yoga for the Shoulders
body: David starts right away with this class and takes you through a quick, effective sequence that releases the areas that are often tight when sitting at a desk. He combines joint movement to increase range of motion with key stretches, breathing and relaxation.

title: 6-Minute Office Yoga for Energy and Stress Relief
body: Be ready because David moves into the class quickly so you can make best use of your available time. He begins with an energizing breathing exercise before taking you through a fairly dynamic hatha flow that keeps the energy moving. He finishes with a meditation to relax the body and calm the nervous system.

title: The Art of Forgiveness
body: In this class, Tracey helps you forgive and move on by grounding you in the present moment through a sequence that helps build strength, flexibility and endurance. Give yourself the space to release, let go and forgive.

title: Slow Flow: Focus on Breathing
body: This class will help you learn to move in harmony with your breath. Starting with a short meditation, Guy guides you through sun salutations, balancing and standing poses, then seated and reclining poses. You will leave feeling calm, centered, and ready to take on the rest of your day.

title: Open Heart Hatha Yoga
body: In this class for all levels, Tianne helps you open your chest and shoulder area, cultivating a deeper opening at your heart centre. You will begin slowly, gently flowing from pose to pose and linking the movement with the breath. Modifications are encouraged to ensure practice is accessible and safe for everyone.

title: Begin at the Beginning
body: In this vigorous intermediate vinyasa yoga class, Tracey helps ground you in the present moment with some strong standing sequences, incorporating plenty of twists and spine-strengthening movements.

title: Flow and Go
body: Tracey guides you through some hip opening, shoulder strengthening and twisting before taking you into side crow. It's a fun vinyasa flow with a little bit of everything!

title: Unpack Your Work Day
body: In this gentle hatha yoga class, Tracey keeps it low to the ground either sitting or kneeling, and helps you unwind from your work day with some neck, shoulder, arm and wrist stretches along with some soft twists. Take some time to slow your thoughts and let your body recover.

title: Slow Flow: Awaken Your Spine
body: In this class, Guy takes you through a gentle hatha yoga flow, while helping you understand and experience the key movements of your spine: extension, forward bending, backward bending, side bending and twisting. He teaches you how to apply the principles in standing, lunging and reclining poses, leaving your spine feeling vibrant and relaxed.

title: Yoga Fun at the Wall
body: This dynamic, full-body vinyasa yoga class takes a well-balanced approach to the body, moving the spine in all directions and including opportunities to release so many muscle groups, including the hamstrings, hips, hip flexors, back and shoulders. As you move through the flow, Crista incorporates using the wall in a creative, supportive way, while progressing safely toward two challenging poses, forearm balance and wheel.

title: Plus Size Yoga: A Gentle Seated Practice
body: This hatha yoga class is all about taking the time for some gentle stretches without transitioning up and down. Staying low to the ground, this class is created especially for students working in bigger bodies and features a series of wonderfully satisfying poses, including a modified reclined twist and Sufi grinds.

title: Yin Yoga for Tight Hips
body: In this yin yoga class, Nyk guides you in and out of two poses that will help release and open your hips: dragon and swan. Don't worry if the full poses aren't available to you today! Nyk offers plenty of variations to make this practice as accessible as possible.

title: A Yoga Flow for Cyclists
body: Just finished a hard bike ride? This class offers the hip and spinal opening that cyclists need to recuperate. Stretch all the tight spots and balance your body!

title: A Beginner Strength-Building Practice
body: In this class, Helen helps get your blood flowing with some sun salutations, warrior I, and warrior II. She closes with a nice long reclined pose. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner Series including: Salute the Sun, Warrior II, Warrior I and Finding Your Savasana.

title: A Beginner Morning Practice
body: Helen guides you through a beginner hatha yoga flow that teaches you how to move from sitting to standing and warm up your body with sun salutations. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner Series including: From Sitting to Standing, Finding Your Feet and Salute the Sun

title: Slow Flow: Standing Room Only
body: Short on time and space? In this class, you’ll be moving your entire body, leaving you refreshed and centered in just a few minutes. We’ll begin with setting an intention, and then we'll move through joint warm-ups, upper body movements, lower body movements, balancing and a final integration - all while standing.

title: Gentle Floor Sequence
body: Crista takes you through a quick floor routine, including poses that stretch the spine, hips, legs and shoulders. It's a great class if you don't have a lot of time and want to feel invigorated, looser and more relaxed.

title: A Beginner Restful Practice
body: In this class, Helen leads you through a calming and centering meditation for body connection followed by a deep savasana. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner Series including: Meditation for Body Connection and Finding Your Savasana.

title: A Beginner Warrior I Practice
body: This beginner hatha yoga class has Helen guiding you through an exploration of warrior I and then balances it out with some nice stretches on the floor. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner Series including: From Sitting to Standing, Warrior I, From Standing to Sitting and Reclined Poses.

title: A Beginner Floor Practice
body: Helen helps you explore some of the basic elements of yoga while seated or lying down, helping you stretch, relax and release tension within a number of effective hatha yoga poses. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner Series including: Finding Your Comfortable Seat, Meditation for Body Connection, Reclined Poses and Finding Your Savasana.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Savasana
body: This class explores the ways in which you can get comfortable in savasana, the final (and possibly the most important) pose in our practice. We will follow our rest with a closing meditation. This class can be done as a stand alone or as a great way to wrap up any practice.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Reclined Poses
body: This class explores some simple stretches that you can do while lying on your back. This class would be great as a stand alone or when followed by Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Savasana.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: From Sitting to Standing
body: This class offers you a few different ways to get from the ground to your feet, whether you are working from hands and knees or downwards facing dog. This class can be done as a stand-alone session, or you can follow it with Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Feet.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: The Basics
body: This class includes both a discussion and demonstration of the basic modifications Helen suggests to make any class comfortable and accessible. Helen talks about making space for your body and how to use props to support you along the way.

title: A Beginner Warrior II Practice
body: This beginner hatha yoga class has Helen taking you through an exploration of warrior II before closing with some stretches on the floor. You will see that this class is the combination of a few of Helen's shorter classes from her Absolute Beginner series including: From Sitting to Standing, Warrior II, From Standing to Sitting and Reclined Poses.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Warrior II
body: This class is a simple exploration of Warrior II for students of all levels who would like to return to the fundamentals. Work to strengthen your legs and challenge your balance as you take your practice to a more dynamic place. This class works well when paired with Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Feet and/or Absolute Beginner Series: Salute the Sun.

title: Sun Salutation B: Tutorial
body: Learn the pacing, breathing and asana essentials needed to practice and master one of the most popular yoga sun salutations, surya namaskar B. This video tutorial is perfect for those who have a confident surya namaskar A practice and want to move on, or for anyone who would like to ground themselves in the fundamentals of this nourishing flow.

title: Yin Yoga for Beginners
body: If you are new to the practice of yin yoga, here are some practice guidelines and poses to help you get started.

title: Yin Yoga for Cyclists II
body: Stretch out and release your spine, hips and hamstrings in this all-levels, yin yoga practice that is perfect for cyclists, but fantastic for anyone, particularly athletes, desk workers and anyone with tightness or discomfort in their back, hips and legs.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Warrior I
body: This class explores Warrior I pose, a posture that both strengthens and stretches the legs and back line of the body. This class would be great when paired with Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Feet and/or Absolute Beginner Series: Salute the Sun.

title: 15-Minute Pick-Me-Up
body: Need a fast pick me up?  Add some zip in your day with this juicy, quick flow that integrates so much is so little time - back bends, side bends, forward folds, twists and stretches for the shoulders, hips and hip flexors.

title: Yin Yoga for Cyclists I
body: Stretch out and release your inner and outer hips in this yin yoga practice specifically designed for cyclists.

title: Crazy Eights
body: In this vigorous power yoga class, Crista teaches you how to move from Astavakrasana (Eight-Angled Pose), into Eka Pada Koundinyasana (Sage Koundinya's Pose) and back. These challenging arm balances will test even advanced yogis, but Crista spends plenty of time warming you up with hip-openers, twists and back bends before you attempt the final peak pose.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Salute the Sun
body: This class moves slowly through both half and full Sun Salutations, using props for support and accessibility. This class can be done as a stand-alone session to warm and stretch the body, or you can start with Absolute Beginner Series: From Sitting to Standing and/or a Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Feet.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Feet
body: This class gets you grounded in mountain pose, followed by an exploration of balance. It can be done as a stand-alone session, or you can start with Absolute Beginner Series: From Sitting to Standing and/or follow it with Absolute Beginner Series: Salute The Sun.

title: Prepare for Arm Balances
body: This class is perfect for beginners who are looking for more challenge and intermediates who are happy with a more foundational class. Rachel gives you everything you need to know when attempting an arm balance, including teaching you technique and preparation. Her clear instruction, precise alignment and enthusiasm will help you move into poses that you may find challenging.

title: Quick and Juicy Shoulder and Hip Opening
body: Need a fast pick me up? This beginner/intermediate hatha flow class moves you through all sorts of shoulder and hip-opening goodness, helping you combat the daily wear and tear of driving and sitting at desks. It's perfect hatha yoga class for a midday pick me up, or an end of day rejuvenation.

title: Light Up Your Core with Power Twists
body:
This challenging beginner class will strengthen your body, fire up your core, power up your chest and upper body, and help you detox. It's a fun class with all of the elements of a satisfying yoga class, including a wonderful relaxation at the end.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 21 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: 30 Minutes of Power
body:
Add some zip to your day with this beginner/intermediate, strengthening power yoga flow. It's a great workout for your core, chest and upper body, and it finishes with a sweet and relaxing savasana.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 10 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Pour Some Sugar On Me
body:
Strengthen your glutes and stabilizing muscles in this keenly sequenced practice to ardha chandra chapasana (sugar cane in the moonlight pose). Rachel will help you build the strength and the technique needed to move fully and gracefully into this challenging, balancing, hip opener.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 16 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Finding Your Comfortable Seat
body: This class is all about finding a way to sit that works for your individual body. Once you find a seat that works for you, we will spend a few minutes grounding ourselves with yogic (ujjayi) breathing.This class can be done as a stand-alone session for relaxation and grounding, or you can follow it with the Absolute Beginner Series: Meditation for Body Connection.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Meditation for Body Connection
body: This class offers you the chance to simply be still. Take a few minutes to get grounded and connected to your big beautiful bod. This class can be done as a stand-alone session, or you can follow it with Absolute Beginner Series: From Sitting to Standing.

title: Flow Into Feeling
body: This intermediate flow invites you to find presence through the sensations that bring each moment and movement to life. The mind learns to listen to, and follow, the guidance of the body through the language of feeling and breath.

title: Dontcha Love Hip Openers?
body: Do you have tight hips? Do you like to move, flow, bind and twist? Crista fills this power yoga flow with loads of hip openers, movement, flow, binds, strengthening and stretching. It's a satisfying, thorough vinyasa class that will leave your hips feeling open and alive!

title: Dig Deeper - Full Class
body: Fiji helps you find the determination and commitment to show up on your mat however you find yourself on this day. This intermediate class offers several variations on some key poses, inviting you to listen to your body and give it the practice it needs right now!

title: Yoga to Build Resilience - Full Class
body: Find the source of your inner resilience with this class that combines pranayama, dynamic flow, and deep rest. Fiji teaches you how to grow your resilience by nurturing yourself on many levels, so you have the energy and wisdom to realise your best self! There is also a shortened version of this class if you're feeling like you don't quite have the time.

title: I Heart Backbends - Full Class
body: Crista leads you through a power yoga class that will release your quads and hip-flexors, strengthen your core and shoulders and carry you into some deep backbends. We created a slightly shorter version of this class a few weeks ago so, if you liked that, you'll love this extended version that takes you just a little bit deeper!

title: The Real Deal Pigeon
body: The beautiful location, Crista's light, fun delivery and the deep release you're about to experience, make this full-length class deeply satisfying and a go-to class for many. In this class, Crista takes you toward the “real” pigeon, Kapotasana, which is a lying backbend done from virasana. The vinyasa yoga flow includes a lot of backbends, side stretches, shoulder openers and twists.

title: Deep Hip Opening
body:
Important: A number of times, Tianne demonstrates how to do a pose, then sits up to continue the class. You are meant to remain in each pose until she shows you how to move to the next one. 

A gentle class focusing on opening the hips, increasing flexibility and mobility of the hip joints. We begin slowly, gently flowing from pose to pose and linking the movement with the breath. Modifications are encouraged to ensure practice is accessible and safe for everyone. All levels welcome.

title: Vinyasa Yoga: Focus On Twists
body:
This is a more gentle vinyasa style yoga class with a focus on using your breath and core to get you into your seated, standing and lunging poses. It's intended to slow you down and allow you to give more attention to your poses, with an emphasis on twists.

This can either be done as a stand-alone class or as Day 13 of the Daily Dose 30-Day Intermediate Yoga Challenge.

title: Learn to Let Go
body: In this class, Tracey leads you in exploring Urdhva Dhanurasana (full wheel pose), helping you discover the expansiveness contained within you. Melt away the tension in your shoulders and thighs, and align your movement with the breath.

title: Rhythm and Routine
body: This intermediate practice flows through familiar sequences that allow the mind and body to synchronize into a harmonized rhythm. We are reminded that the mind often leans into a routine as a source of comfort and determination.

title: Maintain Alignment in Lying Poses
body: In this gentle hatha yoga class, David pays close attention to alignment as he guides you through a series of poses that are all done lying down. Many of the poses will focus on the legs and lower back.

title: Embrace Your Edge
body: In this intermediate/advanced practice, Fiji invites you to embrace the presence, patience and courage required to practice on the boundaries of your comfort zone. The sequences lead you to places you may be challenged on a physical or psychological level and help you learn to soften tension to move toward growth.

title: Yoga to Build Resilience - Shorter Class
body: This intermediate class with Fiji reminds us that our practice is a source of inner resilience, the ability to nurture ourselves on many levels so that we have the ability and energy to spring back from adversity as our best selves. Pranayama, dynamic flow, and deep rest are interwoven to fill your cup on multiple levels. This is a shortened version of a full class with the same name, for the busy yogi's out there.

title: Release Your Inner Hippie
body: Tracey delivers a lovely floor series designed to explore the relationship between your hips, hamstrings and lower back. Slide out of your chair, roll out your mat and embrace your inner hippie!

title: Dig Deeper - Shorter Class
body: In this intermediate flow, Fiji invites you to dig deep into your commitment and determination to show up in any way you can on your mat.  The class offers different levels and variations in some  key poses to allow for in-the-moment responses to the body's needs. This practice is intended to strengthen your ability stay committed to daily practice and to allow the practice to tune into and meet your needs one day at a time.

title: Seize the Moment
body: This vinyasa flow class is a fluid practice balanced in breath and movement. Leave the “to do lists” off the mat and take the time to be with yourself. Arm balances, hip openers, and standing postures are explored. Notice how we can slow down time and strengthen both the muscles of the mind and body.

title: I Heart Backbends - Shorter Class
body: This fun power yoga flow class is full of heart opening and back bending, with lots of time spent on releasing the quadriceps, hip-flexors, internal hip rotators and strengthening the shoulders and core in poses like side plank. This is a slightly shorter version of Crista's full class, for those who are short on time.

title: Build Energy, Open Your Body
body: This big energetic flow helps you build the connection between breath and movement. Tracey leads you through a strong standing series, in which she guides you to connect your front and back body to the midline.

title: How to Improve Mobility Safely
body: This yoga for seniors class helps you understand how to move your body and your joints in a way that is safe, feels good and improves mobility. Our joints are key areas of friction, so maintaining the health of all of our joints will ensure that we have a good chance of being pain-free as we get older.

title: How to Sit, Move and Stretch Safely
body: This gentle hatha yoga class is geared toward those who are 55+ or are new to yoga. David teaches you how to sit so you feel comfortable, how to move in a way that is safe and how to stretch so you get the best out of your yoga practice. It will help to have a few blankets and/or yoga blocks nearby for this class.

title: Maintain Alignment in Standing Poses
body: Understanding alignment is one of the most important aspects of yoga. It can be the difference between feeling good and experiencing pain after a yoga class. In this class, David teaches you how to maintain alignment in some of yoga's more common standing poses.

title: Maintain Alignment in a Hatha Flow Class
body: This slow-paced, hatha flow class is the perfect transition from learning alignment in your poses to a class that flows more from one pose to the next. David makes this class accessible to all levels, while emphasizing yoga's fundamental principles.

title: Maintain Alignment in Seated Poses
body: This class teaches fundamentals that you can carry forward to any class. David helps you understand what proper alignment feels like, helping you get the best out of every class you do.

title: How to Strengthen Your Joints Safely
body: This yoga for seniors class is ideal for the older yogi who wants to maintain or improve their joint strength and flexibility. It's gentle, but provides enough challenge that your body will feel like it's doing some work, benefiting you, your muscles and your bones! If you're 55+ or looking for a gentle class to keep your joints healthy, give this class a try.

title: Yoga for Arthritis: Wrists, Ankles and Feet
body: If you experience tightness or pain in your hands, wrists, ankles or feet, this class will help you find relief. David shows you how to gently and thoroughly stretch the muscles of the hands, fingers, forearms, ankles, feet and toes, helping you avoid or relieve arthritis and joint inflammation. It's helpful to have a couple of blankets, a yoga block (or two) and a strap (or something similar) nearby.

title: Get Started with Yoga
body: This gentle hatha yoga classes teaches you how to know you are doing yoga right, so that you get the most benefit and you avoid injury. David teaches you how to sit, stretch and adapt your poses and movement using yoga props, including blankets, blocks and a chair (if you have them).

title: Push Your Boundaries Safely
body: This quick, playful, vinyasa flow focuses on improving the flexibility of the shoulders, finding more space in our side body and challenges you with the arm balance, Bujapidasana.

title: Gentle Yoga for Reducing Stress
body: This is a gentle yoga class that has a full-body focus, developed to help you feel present and 'in your body'. The selection of asanas (yoga poses), pranayama (breathing exercises) and affirmations are designed to help you rest, rejuvenate and relax.

title: Moving Meditation II
body: This is an advanced intuitive flow full of standing balances, complex transitions, and binds. Fiji encourages you to listen to and follow the harmonised voice of your mind and body, and follow the guidance of your breath.

title: Intro to Flow
body: Break down of the elements of vinyasa flow yoga, including how to do ujayi breath and move through sun salutations safely. This is meant as a starting point for people new to this style of yoga.

title: Altered Perspective
body: A 'Point of View’ or ‘A Frame of Mind’ or ‘A Standpoint’ is the same as our perspective. In this power yoga class, Tracey challenges your viewpoint with an eyes-open practice based on free flowing movement around your mat. It gives a lot of attention to shoulders, heart openers, hips and forward folds. Offer yourself the gift of seeing something differently today!

title: Standing Desk Relief
body: Take a break from your work day and rejuvenate! This standing sequence is perfect for a mid-day office break. Using simple standing poses, you will mobilize your hips, shoulders and spine to relieve stress and reset.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: Know Your Props
body:
This class was created as an addition to the Absolute Beginners series and offers an explanation of the props we often use in yoga. This is a great way for anyone who is new to yoga (or to using props) to get familiar with the variety of things we can use to support us in making our practice more comfortable and accessible.

Note: There is no practice involved in this class.

title: Absolute Beginner Series: From Standing to Sitting
body: Getting back down to the ground can be tricky when you are new to yoga. This class offers options for lowering down from standing in a way that works for your body. Followed up with some seated stretching to lengthen and relax the body.

title: A Full-Body Slow Beginner Flow
body: This slow-paced hatha yoga class takes you through a full range of poses, lying on our back and front, seated and standing, and works on flexibility, balance and strength. Sarah teaches at a gentle pace, paying close attention to details and offering a choice of movements to help you find what will work with your body today. This is a slightly more challenging beginner class than Sarah's previous ones on this site.

title: Energy Boosting Flow
body: Need a quick and delicious pick me up? This flow sequence is designed to boost your energy and open your hips. Continuous movement will help you invigorate blood flow, mobilise areas of tension and deepen your connection to your breath. A perfect practice to transition out of your work day or beat the mid-afternoon doldrums.

title: Hatha Yoga for Better Digestion
body: Full of yummy deep twists, this challenging beginner yoga class helps to massage the internal organs and encourage healthy digestion. Other movements are integrated with the twists, such as spinal flexion and extension. Rachel spends a lot of time helping you learn how to rotate purely from the spine so that you can make the most of each pose.

title: Energy and Intention
body: This practice invites us to bring a devotional quality to the energy and intentions within the class.
